specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: (Dissertação) Digital Currencies in Africa
location: INOV INESC Inovação - Rua Alves Redol, 9 - 7º andar
observations: Para mais informações sff mande um mail para mms@tecnico.ulisboa.pt
objectives:
The objectives for this master thesis are the following: describe the problem and propose and evaluate a solution. The problem should be defined, and the value of a solution justified. The solution should be a design research artefact (constructs, models, methods, or instantiations) that requires knowledge of theory. The evaluation should be based on a demonstration that solves one or more instances of the problem.

The problem is that digital currencies have enormous potential but also huge risks. This is taken to extremes in countries, such as those in Africa, with immature and/or small banking industries where most people are desperate for a proper financial system with payments, lending, insurance, and other financial services that are commodities in Europe. There is an urgent need to regulate the new digital currencies such as Bitcoin, otherwise the systemic risks for those countries may be catastrophic. In this thesis the student will study the existing financial regulation and the financial systems in Africa, and then propose a regulation for bitcoin and other digital currencies in Africa. The evaluation will be performed by comparing the proposal against other similar proposals, interviews with experts, and other approaches. The external supervisor is an expert on financial regulation in Africa.
requirements: The student must dedicate at least three full working days per week to the thesis, and manage the thesis as a project using Scrum.

supervisors: Pedro Manuel Moreira Vaz Antunes de Sousa (100%)
specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projeto: Enterprise Architecture in an Agile world
objectives:
More and more organizations have Enterprise Architecture Units, with the mission to streamline IT development strategy as to ensure alignment between business and IT. The role of Enterprise Architecture is increasingly clear and understood as fundamental within organizations.
However, Enterprise Architecture approaches do not fit well to agile approaches, because the first requires too much planning and the second requires too little planning.

The goal of the thesis is to propose a method and a configuration on Atlas to support Enterprise Architecture in an organization with agile development process.
Atlas is an Enterprise Architecture tool from Link Consulting (www.linkconsulting.com),  The Atlas is a product developed in Portugal focused on representation and alignment of organizations, which already has the large customer organizations with the Petrobras, EDP, Portugal Telecom, Sonae Group, GALP,  ANACOM, Banco BPI, Fidelity Insurance, among others.

The work will occur inside the Link Consulting Enterprise Archiecture team, with projects tens of organizations, in Portugal and other countries.

title: [Dissertação] Leveraging LLVM IR to automatically map Deep Neural Networks in reconfigurable accelerators
observations:
- Assignment of this thesis is subject to a prior informal interview with the candidate to assess his motivation and prior knowledge in the fields of research
- This thesis involves challenging aspects recognized by the scientific community; accordingly, the outcome of this work may give rise to the publication of scientific articles.
objectives:
Recent advances in Deep Neural Networks (DNN) provided important algorithmic breakthroughs in many domains, such as computer vision, speech recognition, natural language processing, drug discovery, genomics, etc. Such breakthroughs have been achieved through deeper and non-uniform neural networks, by integrating new layer types (e.g, convolutional and/or recurrent layers), new activation functions and through advances in the training methodologies. 

However, the computational requirements of these algorithms, allied with the ever-increasing amount of data availability, have pushed the computing capacity of off-the-shelf processing architectures (e.g., CPU and GPU) to their limit. This drove a renewed interest to dedicated accelerator architectures in the industry. However, these new architectures (e.g., Google 's TPU) mostly focus on accelerating the inference phase. In fact, the training phase is still performed in off-the-shelf systems, making developers wait several weeks to train a DNN, a problem which is expected to worsen as DNNs become sparser, more complex and less susceptible to acceleration.

To tackle this issue, a new DNN accelerator is currently under development that exploits reconfigurable technology to enable architecture adaptation. It aims at providing support for both the training and inference phases by dynamically reconfiguring its architecture, to suit the computational requirements of each phase and to match the neural network topology, making the execution as efficient as possible.

Accordingly, the aim of this thesis is to investigate new compiler techniques to automatically detect the computing structure, topology and data-flow characteristics of a DNN and map them to the accelerator under development. These new techniques will leverage the LLVM compiler intermediate representation (IR) language to infer opportunities to reduce numerical precision, apply vectorization and introduce approximate computing techniques as a mechanism to accelerate DNN applications in reconfigurable hardware.
requirements:
- Knowledge of C programming language- Minimum average grade: >14 in 1st cycle and >15 in 2nd cycle
- Personal interview, before thesis application

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: qDocs/LegalTech – Agilizar processos legais do Cidadão, através de uma Plataforma de Automação de Documentos centrada no Cidadão
objectives:
O qDocs é uma plataforma de automação de documentos, centrada no Cidadão, multi-Curador, geridos de forma distribuída, dinâmica e segura, e acessíveis a partir de qualquer tipo de equipamento tecnológico (e.g., smartphones, tablets, computadores). 
Por um lado, o qDocs permite a definição e utilização de templates de documentos electrónicos (e.g., documentos de identificação, certificados, relatórios, formulários, questionários) com base na orquestração de serviços e de dados mantidos por diferentes Curadores (i.e., entidades públicas e privadas), e geridos de forma distribuída, dinâmica e segura. Por outro lado, o qDocs é uma plataforma colaborativa que promove e facilita a relação entre o Cidadão e os Curadores em todos os processos que envolvam a solicitação, publicação, acesso, apresentação ou partilha de documentos electrónicos. (Consultar https://qdocs.eu/ para mais informações.)

No âmbito deste projeto pretende-se investigar a aplicação da tecnologia e paradigma qDocs ao contexto do domínio legal, nomeadamente da relação do cidadão com a justiça, mediada por empresas de advogacia de média/grande dimensão. Neste contexto, pretende-se que estas empresas (aqui designadas como “curadores”) possam prestar serviços de elaboração e assinatura de contratos e de outros documentos com força jurídica (e.g., minutas, contratos comerciais, contratos de trabalho) e também garantir outros requisitos, tais como o reconhecimento e autenticação de assinaturas das partes (e.g., entre pessoas, ou entre pessoas e empresas). Pretende-se com este projeto que o aluno possa investigar as seguintes áreas de “document automation systems”, “legal tech”, “smart contracts”, e possa aplicar, prototipar e avaliar cenários de utilização.

Para tal, este projeto deverá desenvolver-se ao longo de três fases:
A primeira fase consiste na análise e definição do problema através de uma arquitectura do sistema de informação e suportada pelas seguintes perspectivas (vistas): definição de stakeholders, processos de negócio, aplicações e bases de dados, e documentos eletrónicos e/ou físicos envolvidos. 
A segunda fase consiste no desenho e prototipagem da solução “qDocs/LegalTech”, pela definição dos tipos de templates de documentos identificados, e pela definição e estabelecimento dos conectores às bases de dados existentes nos curadores. 
A terceira fase consiste na disponibilização da solução “qDocs/LegalTech” num contexto controlado, na sua divulgação, avaliação e discussão dos resultados.

supervisors: Miguel Nuno Dias Alves Pupo Correia (50%)
title: Dissertation: Secure Data Storage for Blockchains
observations: Tema reservado para Marcelo Silva
objectives:
Blockchain is a promising new technology that is generating a vast interest world-wide, Portugal included [1]. A Blockchain is an ordered log of transactions that runs in several nodes connected by the Internet; it is possible to append new transactions to the log, but not modify those already logged. The original Blockchain was the core of the Bitcoin cryptocurrency, but today the term is used generically. Many popular Blockchains and Blockchain software products exist, e.g., Ethereum, Hyperledger Fabric, and Ripple. 
In the European project QualiChain (https://qualichain-project.eu/), we are developing a Blockchain-based system to enforce authenticity of university certificates, such as those issued by Técnico for its students. The idea is to store certificate data in a blockchain, in such a way that when an entity receives a curriculum from a candidate, it is able to check with the Blockchain if the candidate certificate(s) is(are) authentic. 
A natural approach would be store the certificates in the Blockchain, but certificates are reasonably large (e.g., 1 MB), so storing all certificates from all users in the Blockchain would make the log extremely large (consider for example that a Bitcoin transaction uses just a few bytes). 
The objective of this thesis is to design and implement a new secure data storage system for use with Blockchains such as Ethereum. There are already a few solutions, e.g., IPFS that is based on a peer-to-peer voluntary network of nodes [2], DepSky that uses several cloud storage services to increase security [3], and Metadisk that is also peer-to-peer but more focused on Blockchain [4].
The thesis will leverage ideas from these two types of distributed data stores — those based on peer-to-peer and those on clouds (or generically Byzantine quorum systems) — to build a secure data store that can be connected to Ethereum and store data such as student certificates. The thesis will involve designing this system, implementing it, and testing it. 
References:
[1] Peck, Morgen E. "Blockchains: How they work and why they'll change the world." IEEE spectrum 54.10 (2017): 26-35.
[2] Benet, Juan. "Ipfs-content addressed, versioned, p2p file system." arXiv preprint arXiv:1407.3561 (2014).
[3] Bessani, Alysson, et al. "DepSky: dependable and secure storage in a cloud-of-clouds." ACM Transactions on Storage (TOS) 9.4 (2013): 12.
[4] Wilkinson, Shawn, Jim Lowry, and Tome Boshevski. "Metadisk a blockchain-based decentralized file storage application." Storj Labs Inc., Technical Report, hal (2014): 1-11.
requirements:
Courses with grade >= 14: Sistemas Distribuídos ou SIRS Good programming skills.
Interest in security and blockchain.
Disponibilidade e motivação para realizar o projeto em tempo integral, 40 horas/semana (excepto cadeiras do curso).

title: Dissertation: Map Procedural Generation for World of War Online
location: GAIPS / INESC-ID / IST Taguspark and Chilltime (Núcleo Central, Taguspark)
observations: Since this dissertation involves working with the commercial game “World War Online”, development will mainly take place at Chilltime game development studio, sited in Núcleo Central of Taguspark. Development will mostly be in the C# programming language, using the Unity 3D engine.
objectives:
Procedural Content Generation (PCG), i.e. how game content can be created algorithmically, is an increasingly important field and one of the most active topics within the software game industry and game research. This work will focus on the procedural generation of maps for the commercial real-time strategy game, "World War Online", from Chilltime, and will be developed in close collaboration with the game's development studio. More specifically, this work will research how the players' past performance can inform the procedural generation of new maps emphasising certain mechanics while creating a challenge that matches both the designer's view as well as the players' skill and, overall, create a better focused experience for the players.

Main sub-goals:
( 1 ) Literature review (semester 1)
( 2 ) Computational model (semester 1 and 2)
( 3 ) Test scenario implementation (semester 2)
( 4 ) User studies (semester 2)
requirements: This thesis proposal is open to all MSc students from the Master Degree in Information Systems and Computer Engineering of Instituto Superior Técnico.

title: [Project] Code-Stepping Regular Expressions in the Browser
observations:
More information at: 
http://web.ist.utl.pt/jose.fragoso/

This project may result in a collaboration with the VetSpec group at Imperial College London.
objectives:
JavaScript is the most widespread dynamic language [1]. It is the de facto language for client-side web applications; it is used for server-side scripting with Node.js and it even runs on small embedded devices. JavaScript regular expressions are an essential part of the language. They are often used for parsing user input and messages coming from the network and they play a key role in securing Web applications. In fact, JS developers commonly rely on regular expressions to write complex string sanitisers to prevent a variety of security attacks, such as cross site scripting (XSS) and cross site request forgery [2]. 

The behaviour of JS regular expressions is specified in the ECMAScript Standard (version 10) [3]. The ECMAScript standard is a long, complex document, written in English, about 900 pages long. Furthermore, it keeps growing every year in response to the ever-growing demand of the JavaScript community. Hence, understanding the exact behaviour of JavaScript regular expressions is becoming harder to achieve, whilst new business and cyber-security challenges make it of escalating importance. 

If understanding the behaviour of JavaScript regular expressions is hard, programming them is even harder. It is an extremely error prone task, which often leads programmers to resort to trial-and-error approaches. Furthermore, the debugging facilities provided by all browsers and IDEs for JavaScript programming are lacking when it comes to regular expressions. In fact, browsers do not allow the programmer to code step regular expressions matches. The process of matching a string against a given regular expression is presented to the programmer as a single atomic operation, shedding no light as to why an expected match did not occur or an unexpected match did occur. 

The goal of this thesis is to implement a Chrome plug-in [4] to allow JavaScript programmers to code-step regular expression matches. The student will work with a reference interpreter of JavaScript regular expressions developed by the Verified Trustworthy Software Specification (VetSpec) group at Imperial College London, a world leading group in the specification and verification of Web programs. 

[1] w3techs.com/technologies/details/cp-javascript
[2] J. Weinberger et al. A Systematic Analysis of XSS Sanitisation in Web Application Frameworks. ESORICS’11. 
[3] ECMAScript Committee. The 10th Edition of the ECMAScript Language Specification. ECMA. 2019
[4] Browser Extensions – Developer Guide. Google Chrome. Online documentation.
requirements: Strong programming skills.

title: Dissertação: Otimização de Métodos Monte-Carlo na Resolução de Sistemas Lineares para Problemas de Grande Escala
observations: Co-orientação externa: Prof. Juan Acebron, ISCTE (juan.acebron@gmail.com)
objectives:
Os métodos probabilísticos baseados em algoritmos Monte Carlo existem na literatura desde há muito tempo. No entanto para determinados problemas como a resolução de equações em derivadas parciais (PDEs),  sistemas de álgebra linear, e cálculo de funções matriciais têm sido escassamente utilizados em geral. Isto é devido basicamente à lenta convergência do método para a solução, inerente a qualquer algoritmo Monte Carlo.

No entanto, nos últimos anos parece ter ressurgido um renovado interesse pelos métodos Monte Carlo como método alternativo aos clássicos na resolução de inúmeros problemas em Física e Engenharia. Fundamentalmente devido à existência na atualidade de supercomputadores compostos por grande número de cores, estes algoritmos podem ser explorados muito eficientemente por serem naturalmente paralelizáveis. Contudo, existe um problema fundamental inerente aos métodos Monte Carlo utilizados especificamente na resolução de PDEs e sistemas lineares para problemas de grande escala. O problema aparece quando o tamanho do domínio e/ou da matriz supera os limites de memória dum dos nós de memória partilhada, sendo portanto necessário distribuir o problema/matriz entre os diferentes nós computacionais de memória distribuída. Por serem as diferentes tentativas das simulações Monte Carlo de natureza aleatória estas criam padrões de intercomunicação muito complexos, e polo que é fundamental dispor de algoritmos fortemente optimizados que permitam reduzir o impacto dessa intercomunicação entre os nós distribuídos, de maneira a melhorar a escalabilidade global do algoritmo.

O objetivo desta Tese é desenhar um algoritmo eficiente de comunicação entre os diferentes nós, optimizado ao máximo para ser executado em arquitecturas híbridas de memória partilhada e distribuída. O algoritmo posteriormente será integrado em algoritmos específicos que resolvem PDEs e sistemas de álgebra linear. A seguir e mediante diferentes benchmarks serão executados  diferentes testes de escalabilidade utilizando supercomputadores massivamente paralelos pertencentes a infraestruturas de supercomputação europeias.
requirements: Os estudantes interessados em realizar esta Tese de Mestrado deverão ter frequentado a cadeira de Computação Paralela e Distribuída.

title: Dissertation: Aplications of Relational and Symbolic Reinforcement Learning in Games
objectives:
Esta tese tem como objectivo integrar abordagens de aprendizagem por reforço com abordagens baseadas em representação de conhecimento (por exemplo através de lógica proposicional). Neste trabalho pretende-se explorar e estudar as área de “Relational Reinforcement Learning” e “Deep Symbolic Reinforcement Learning”. Este tipo de abordagens consegue representar conhecimento de forma explícita num modelo, e utilizar esse conhecimento para mais facilmente generalizar o modelo para novas situações não previstas. Este tipo de abordagem foi recentemente  aplicada ao StarCraft 2 com bastante sucesso, e pretende-se neste trabalho estudar as propriedades deste tipo de abordagens em termos de capacidades de generalização e de representação.

Organização

Em termos de organização, o trabalho visa as seguintes etapas: a) Levantamento do estado da arte em aprendizagem por reforço, aprendizagem por reforço profunda, aprendizagem por reforço relacional, aprendizagem simbólica de aprendizagem por reforço. b) Aplicação de um algoritmo estado da arte a um cenário de um jogo simples, c) treino de um agente utilizando várias técnicas d) análise dos resultados;  e) Escrita da tese.
requirements: Recomenda-se a frequência da cadeira de Planeamento, Aprendizagem e Decisão Inteligente

title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Synthesise Software Specifications from GitHub Threads using NLP
observations:
Complementary information and requirements:

- A Curated List of Resources Dedicated to Text Summarization ( https://github.com/mathsyouth/awesome-text-summarization )
- Toward Extractive Summarization of Online Forum Discussions via Hierarchical Attention Networks ( https://arxiv.org/pdf/1805.10390.pdf )
objectives:
Documents are important sources of system requirements. This is particularly true of domains that are document-centric in terms of their operational and development processes. FOSS projects often discuss several of the software requirements using GitHub threads. In this project we would like to understand how system requirements are being discussed in Github threads, and develop a NLP-based approach to synthesise requirements from the threads. 

Goals: 

• Study the current practices of description of specifications on GitHub threads
• Implement a NLP-based synthesiser of software requirements, leveraging neural approaches for text summarization

Ref:
Ilieva, M. G., and Olga Ormandjieva. "Automatic transition of natural language software requirements specification into formal presentation." International Conference on Application of Natural Language to Information Systems. Springer, Berlin, Heidelberg, 2005.
requirements:
Good Commandment of EnglishGood Commandment of NLP and Deep Learning Technologies
Interest for Software Engineering
Knowledge of GitHub

supervisors: José Manuel da Costa Alves Marques (100%)
title: Projeto: Reconhecimento facial no contexto do controlo de acessos e oferta de serviços personalizados
objectives:
A utilização dos dados biométricos que está maioritariamente a ser usada é ainda incipiente (ex: impressões digitais) e usada como complemento de outros meios de autentificação.
A utilização do reconhecimento facial assume-se como uma das áreas mais inovadoras para identificação de pessoas, que deve permitir uma maior e melhor oferta de serviços e produtos associados.
Quais os melhores algoritmos que podem ser usados, em cada situação particular, quando e como tratar as várias variantes associadas que podem surgir com a idade, com óculos, com cabelo diferente, com diferentes condições ambientais, etc, são algumas das vertentes que têm que ser tidas em conta.
Quais os repositórios onde devem estar as fotos de referência (Cloud, OnPremise) devem considerar aspetos como a rapidez, qualidade e privacidade.
Este trabalho destina-se a identificar e avaliar, bem como definir e melhorar, algoritmos que melhor possam realizar a identificação com as várias variantes: características físicas, ambientais (ex: contraste, claridade, etc.), movimentos, e a sua adequação aos casos práticos.
Fazer a distinção entre o momento de tirar a foto, como os pontos de referência do rosto, se está a sorrir ou não, se está de olhos fechados, etc., e o tratamento e identificação com a foto de referência.
As soluções e algoritmos a estudar devem considerar várias vertentes, tais como dispositivos móveis, soluções na cloud, híbridas, etc. 
Pretende-se avaliar estes modelos em vários contextos práticos, nomeadamente no IoT, controlo nos transportes públicos, controlo de acessos em edifícios ou instalações sensíveis, acesso a sistemas de informação, etc. 
O objetivo final do trabalho será a exploração dos limites na utilização deste tipo de tecnologias para as finalidades propostas assim como os recursos necessários para a sua implementação prática. Deverá ser desenvolvido um piloto demonstrador para a validação prática dos resultados.
requirements: A execução do trabalho requer capacidade de investigação e para abordar os desafios associados às tecnologias envolvidas, bem proatividade para sugerir soluções funcionais e inovadoras

supervisors: Jacinto Carlos Marques Peixoto do Nascimento (100%)
title: Dissertation: Scalable Breast Cancer Multi-Label Annotations (SBCMLA)
objectives:
This project proposes the development of a scalable multi-label annotation User Interface (UI) within a breast cancer diagnosis scope. The purpose of this UI is to efficiently acquire multiple labels from clinicians for a collection of Multi-Modality Medical Imaging (MI) technologies. Such Multi-Modalities are three: (1) MammoGraphy (MG) containing both Cranio-Caudal (CC) and Mediolateral Oblique (MLO) views; (2) UltraSound (US); and (3) Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI). The use of hierarchical labels aims to speed up the diagnosis process for further examinations. It is known that the radiologists are facing the growth of the medical data, which turns the diagnosis a difficult task to be performed in a timely manner. To accomplish this goal the proposed work has the two following stages:

 

(1) Acquisition of hierarchical labelling:

To this end, a UI will be developed to show sequential images to the radiologist. For each image, a set of queries regarding the labels of each image is formulated. Specifically, the mammography images are firstly presented in the UI, and a query for mammography tissue classification is presented (dense vs. adipose). If the tissue is of difficult analysis (i.e. is dense) the UI automatically changes the modality (i.e., US), formulating new questions about the existence of lesions. If there exist findings, then a third query-stage a third stage concerning malignancy is presented. This allows to obtain a database with hierarchical labels.

 

 (2) Hierarchical learning of breast Multi-Modality:

The previous point allows to obtain a hierarchical labeling for a large number of frames. This can be used to train a Deep Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN) that aims to classify the exam. This constitutes an Artificial Intelligence (AI) agent in the UI. In this way the AI agent exploits correlation, hierarchy, and sparsity of the breast label distributions.

From the above, it is necessary to collect labels or notes of several clinical variables of interest provided by medical experts. For the collection of this information, the design and development of a system is necessary that will allow the user (in this case, the medical specialist) to query and label various patient characteristics, and that also allows for a UI, particularly, in providing the information of the labels. For these reasons, it is crucial for the development of this project, cooperation with experts providing the above information.

title: Dissertation: Efficient self-tuning of cloud applications
objectives:
In recent years we have witnessed a trend for the cloud providers to increase the diversity of the platforms they offer, namely with respect to computational power, memory, storage capacity and network bandwidth. If it’s true that this diversity allows users to choose amongst a broader set, it is also a true that such diversity renders the process of selecting the right configuration much more complex. This happens because configurations with similar performance may possess very different costs. Moreover, it is not always easy to anticipate which is the cheaper configuration that complies with the application requirements. 
Thus, the study of techniques for automating the process of selecting the best configuration to execute cloud applications has gained relevance. 

Recent approaches to identify the optimal configuration to execute cloud applications are based on an exploration phase, during which the application is executed in a set of configurations. These systems have been shown to identify near-optimal configurations. However, the cost of the exploration phase, which can be rather high, is not taken into account. 

This dissertation studies search techniques that consider the cost of the exploration phase. The plan is to investigate techniques that allow testing, during the exploration phase, configurations by using a reduced subset of the original data (e.g., a smaller training set when training machine learning models or smaller graphs in the context of graph analytics applications). While using smaller datasets allows each configuration to be tested more efficiently, the challenge is to project the information obtained when using small datasets to estimate the quality of configurations that use the whole dataset.

title: ​Dissertação: FPGA accelerated model checking of regulatory networks
objectives:
Models of biological networks have been studied through simulations using a number of software tools. However, the intrinsic disparity between the sequential nature of microprocessor architecture used in software-based simulations and the highly parallel nature of biological systems may result in prohibitively long simulation times.

In this work, we adopt an alternative approach to simulation of biological systems using hardware-software based emulation.
Previous works on hardware acceleration have reported speedups up to 17,000x when compared to existing software simulation approaches.

Hardware accelerators are often based on reconfigurable logic (FPGAs) which allow to have highly customized circuit implementations, and can be attached to a computer via PCI-Express or be standalone, making use of an ARM dual-core processor included in the device fabric.
The development of hardware accelerators can be done using frameworks which include High-Level Synthesis tools (Intel, Xilinx) which allows the developer to specify a high-performance hardware-software system without knowledge of low-level system design. This allows Software Engineers to design hardware accelerators without relying on a hardware engineer to implement it.

In this thesis the focus is on the optimization the common model-checker (http://lvl.info.ucl.ac.be/Tools/NuSMV-ARCTL-TLACE) used in the emulation of biological systems, and on the implementation of the most computational intensive parts in the hardware accelerator. The software (C/C++) will be running on the ARM inside the FPGA.
It is expected to have a demonstrator running on FPGA embedded system.
requirements: Good programming skills and interest in embedded systems/FPGA accelerators is a plus.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: (Project) Workflow for processing historic digitised works at the United Nations
location: INESC-ID Alameda or TagusPark (opportunity for a visit to ARMS in New York during the second semester of the project)
observations:
This is expected to be an engineering project, to build a framework based on state of the art existing technology
The research will comprise to raise a state of the art of technology for OCR, like for example Tesseract: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tesseract_(software), open-source tools for image processing in general (e.g., to improve contrast, etc.), for PDF generation (including an interesting challenge in merging on the same PDF file the text from multiple OCR tasks), etc.
The results will be immediately used by ARMS:
- https://archives.un.org/
But will also be disseminated by:
- UN Technology Bank: https://www.un.org/technologybank/
- The archive of the League of Nations (a twin of ARMS in Geneva): https://libraryresources.unog.ch/leagueofnationsarchives
- The other entities of the UN Systems https://www.unsystem.org/content/un-system
objectives:
The mission of historical archives is to curate and provide access to unique collections of information of intemporal permanent value. In principle, each archive is unique, making the global access to paper born collections a challenge. A solution for that is to digitise those collections and publish them on-line.
The Archives and Records Management Service (ARMS) of the United Nations curates unique historical archives of the United Nations (what will be 75 year hold in 2020). ARMS has been digitising some of those documents (so far >10 million images and >5 TBytes, but needs a proper automated workflow to process the digitised images for an optimal on-line publishing and search, ideally all based on open-source software (reusing existing components or new developed ones). Problems are at three domains: 
- OCR (Optical Character Recognition): some documents have complex layouts; collections can be in several languages
- Document size: some documents can be of hundreds or thousands of pages, of several sizes (fotos, diplomatic cable, investigation reports, etc.)
- Legibility: almost all documents with text are printed/typed, but some are quite old  
 The results of the project are expected to inform ARMS for the re-engineering of its future improved digital archive, which for now has only a minimal functionality: https://search.archives.un.org/
requirements: Experience or willing to learn in detail programming with common languages (mainly JavaScritp for front-ends, as also at least one common language for back-end services, as Java, Python, etc.). Interest in learning about OCR (Optical Character Recognition) with machine learning techniques, and learning about fundamental image processing techniques, especially to improve readability of digitised documents (mainly for PDF/A files, but also to explore other solutions such as for example for "flip page": https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Flip_page).Work will be done in close collaboration with ARMS team in New York (video-conference, with communication in English, opportunity for a visit to ARMS in New York during the second semester of the project).

title: [Dissertation] Time-offset compensation for AI-assisted fast channel change on DVB set-top-boxes
observations:
- This thesis will be realized under as agreement between IST and NOS Inovação and it will be jointly supervised by: Prof. Nuno Roma (IST), Dr. Nuno Sebastião (NOS Inovação), Prof. Tiago Dias (ISEL)
- Assignment of this thesis is subject to a prior informal interview with the candidate to assess his motivation and prior knowledge in the fields of research
- This thesis involves challenging aspects recognized by the scientific community; accordingly, the outcome of this work may give rise to the publication of scientific articles.
objectives:
Digital Video Broadcast (DVB) systems typically suffer from a high channel change (zapping) time. Nevertheless, with the recent advent of Artificial Intelligence systems, it became possible to accurately predict the channels that the user will most likely change to. 

Accordingly, locally available resources have been exploited to perform the pretuning of the predicted channels and, thus, significantly reduce the channel change time. Despite its effectiveness, such method is typically limited by the amount of available resources in the set-top-box (STB) (e.g. memory and number of tuners in the STB). To overcome such constraints, other methods have also been devised, in particular, the delivery of stream chunks, on request, via unicast on top of an IP network. 

This approach has the advantage of allowing a fast channel change to any channel that cannot be locally pretuned, although not being as effective as the other one due to the dependency on the network conditions. Moreover, it introduces an additional time-offset in the displayed stream time, because the unicast assisted stream lags behind the locally tuned stream. This additional time-offset is particularly disturbing when live events are being watched (e.g. a football match).

The goal of this work is to design a software module to compensate for the additional time-offset imposed by the unicast assisted channel change method. Such module should control the system’s playback parameters (e.g. the system’s time clock) to smoothly compensate for the playback time offset, as well as to reduce the additional buffer capacity that the unicast assisted pretune requires.
requirements:
- Knowledge of C programming language- Minimum average grade: >14 in 1st cycle and >15 in 2nd cycle
- Personal interview, before thesis application

title: ​Dissertação: Efficient data structures for ​Boolean functions
objectives:
​Computational modeling is increasingly recognized as a necessary and valuable approach to understand dynamical features of complex systems. In particular, the logical framework has proved to be successful to ​analyze discrete event systems (e.g. cellular regulatory networks).​
​​
This thesis will focus on the definition​ and development​ of a library for function representation and manipulation, creating an abstraction layer for possible algorithmic applications.​ The library should be extensible for future representations.
Applications can then ask the library for functions in the appropriate format, leaving to the library the work of (possibly) translating between distinct representations.

Such library will be applicable to real case scenarios, such as the analyses of signaling-regulatory networks, logical synthesis, symbolic verification, pattern generation, among others.

supervisors: Jacinto Carlos Marques Peixoto do Nascimento (50%)
title: Dissertation: SeriousGames em Realidade Virtual e Realidade Aumentada,
location: Instituto de Sistemas e Robótica - Torre Norte
observations: O/a candidato/a necessita deverá possuir conhecimentos de programação orientada a objetos (C#) e de Unity Games engine.
objectives: Com o aumento da esperança média de vida surgem também diversas patologias neurológicas associadas ao envelhecimento como é o caso das demências. Uma das mais comuns, a doença de Alzheimer afecta principalmente o hipocampo (estrutura do cérebro responsável pela capacidade de aprendizagem e memória explícita) dificultando assim as actividades do dia-a-dia. A maioria das intervenções atuais não se têm revelado eficazes uma vez que se baseiam tarefas que recorrem a processos associados à memória explícita. Para isso, esta proposta de trabalho propõe o desenvolvimento de um set de SeriousGames em Realidade Virtual e Realidade Aumentada, com recurso a equipamentos como o caso do headset de VR HTC Vive. Os serious Games desenvolvidos serão baseados em técnicas psicológicas de aprendizagem e memorização implícita, tal como o Errorless learning que se tem mostrado eficazes em intervenção com doentes de Alzheimer.

supervisors: Miguel Nuno Dias Alves Pupo Correia (100%)
title: Dissertation: Dynamic Malware Analysis: Ransomware and Cryptojacking
observations: Tema reservado para Diogo Vilela (84710)
objectives:
There are two types of malware that are recent (less than 5 years old) and have been particularly damaging in recent years: 
* ransomware, that encrypts the contents of the victim's disk, then asks for a payment (ransom), typically in a cryptocurrency like Bitcoin; 
* cryptojacking, that steals CPU time and energy from the victim in order to mine a cryptocurrency, e.g., again Bitcoin or Monero.
These two types of malware have two interesting aspects in common: 
* they can be detected by observing indirect symptoms in the computer, e.g., disk access rate and CPU consumption;
* the damage they cause is not instantaneous, so it is worth it to monitor these symptoms and detect them.
This scenario suggests the use of a machine learning (ML) approach: 
* run many specimens of such malware in different situations (e.g., different computation loads);
* observe the symptoms observed in terms of a set of features;
* define a classifier that is able to detect them.
The objective of the thesis is to design and implement a platform to analyse malware dynamically (i.e., by running it) and implement this ML approach. The platform will be essentially a program that will be able to run a system image (using virtualization or on bare metal), setup the system, take some action that infects it with a malware specimen, then monitors its behavior (a set of features) for a defined interval of time. The thesis will also include using the platform to study ransomware and/or cryptojacking and create a classifier to detect them.
Expected outputs:
* thesis
* scientific article
* platform available online (github)
requirements:
Courses with grade >= 14: Sistemas Operativos, Segurança Informática em Redes e Sistemas ou Segurança de Software, Sistemas de Apoio à DecisãoGood programming skills.
Disponibilidade e motivação para realizar o projeto em tempo integral, 40 horas/semana (excepto cadeiras do curso).

title: Dissertation: Programming Languages for Secure Smart Contracts
objectives:
Language-based security approaches to blockchain-based smart contracts is an area of increasing importance.
  
The goals of this project are: i) to survey existing languages that focus on verification of smart-contracts (e.g. Scilla [1] and Liquidity [2]); and ii) use one of these languages to implement a library of verified contracts that are useful (e.g. a library of contracts for double-auctions). 

Students interested in compiling might be interested in exploring compilation from one of these verification-based languages into a more widely-used language, such as Solidity (or directly into EVM).

[1] https://scilla-lang.org
[2] http://www.liquidity-lang.org
requirements:
Interested students should:

1. Enjoy programming and learning about new programming languages and technologies
2. Be interested in software engineering and software reliability
3. Be willing to learn new concepts and tools, and to apply them in real-world scenarios

title: [Dissertation] Collective Choices under Liquid Democracy
location: Group on Artificial Intelligence for People and Society (GAIPS), INESC-ID, IST Taguspark, U Lisboa
observations: For more information, please contact Francisco C. Santos (email: franciscocsantos@tecnico.ulisboa.pt, web: http://web.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/franciscocsantos/)
objectives: Liquid democracy (LD) combines direct democratic participation with a highly flexible model of representation. Citizens can freely choose to either vote directly on individual policy‐issues, or to delegate their votes to issue‐competent representatives who vote on their behalf. This principle has been discussed alternatively under the terms of delegative democracy, or proxy voting. Such delegation process is shaped by the topology of the social networks. In this thesis the candidate shall evaluate the performance of LD against direct voting for various network topologies. The candidate shall address this problem also from an game theoretical perspective: Individuals shall aim at balancing the trade-off between the accuracy offered by their choices (either by voting directly or through proxy) and the effort they spend, together with returns that are dependent on the voting outcomes.
requirements: The nature of the project requires a particular appetence for interdisciplinary topics, game theory, network science, and agent-based simulations.

title: Dissertação: Generative Data Augmentation for Source Code Analysis
observations:
Esta tese é realizada em colaboração com a empresa Outsystems.

O orientador pela Outsystems é Hugo Veiga (hugo.veiga@outsystems.com).
objectives: Training of Deep Learning models is known for being a data-hungry process. However there are some domains where data is scarce. One of those domains is source code. Although there is a lot of it available in platforms such as GitHub, it's actually relatively difficult to find a big number of examples of large, high quality, software projects. Data scarcity can be overcome by generating more data. For this work we're aiming at the creation of generative models for data augmentation datasets which will be used for source code analysis. The generation process must create data in a way that maintains the properties of the original dataset, so that models trained on it generalize well. This can include the use of GANs (generative adversarial networks) or other data augmentation techniques.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: [Projeto] Gestão de dados em Indústria 4.0 - The Navigator Company
location: Posto de trabalho no IST ou INESC-ID (Alameda ou Tagus) e visitas a instalações da The Navigator
observations:
Este projecto será executado ao abrigo desta colaboração entre a The Navigator Company e o IST:
http://www.thenavigatorcompany.com/var/ezdemo_site/storage/original/application/b8a6a7210fac7ff2099d37be7785f9ef.pdf 
O projecto contará portanto com o acompanhamento de pelo menos um co-orientador da The Navigator Company (ainda a designar)
objectives:
The Navigator Company (http://www.thenavigatorcompany.com/) é uma empresa nacional e umas das maiores empresas mundiais na indústria do papel. A empresa possui várias fábricas, cada uma delas equipada com equipamentos diversos, e com tecnologia variada na idade e na sua diversidade. A empresa produz ainda vários tipos de produtos com base no papel, para clientes em todo o mundo. Neste momento a empresa não tem uma solução para a identificação, recolha e gestão centralizada dos dados de produção, o que a limita para os seus objectivos de inovação com base no potencial da visão Indústria 4.0. 
O objectivo desta tese será uma contribuição para a solução desse problema.
O problema é complexo, e a sua abordagem ainda por fazer na quase totalidade, pelo que, dependendo dos desafios que se forem identificando na fase de análise, e dependendo dos interesses do aluno, os resultados poderão ser mais conceptuais (por exemplo, uma representação arquitectural da realidade da empresa que permita criar um "viewpoint" para este objectivo) ou mais tecnológica (por exemplo, demonstrar soluções de recolha e gestão centralizadas de dados para uma situação concreta).
requirements: Espera-se que neste projecto exista oportunidade para aplicar conceitos de análise e modelação de dados, integração de dados (eventualmente de ETL), análise de processos de negócio, e modelação para arquitectura empresarial.

title: Dissertação: ART@Streams
observations: Survey the state-of-the-art of the related work. Design and development of a prototype. Testing and performance evaluation. Writing of a technical paper (10 pages) that frames and presents the work carried out, and describes the results achieved.
objectives:
The goal of this work is to design and develop an extension to distributed stream processing systems, such as Flink or Spark, to address resource-efficiency and timeliness guarantees. In such systems, often, it is not possible to achieve have accuracy, resource budgets, and timeliness goals simultaneously.

The motivation for this work is to design a framework that explores the tradeoffs among these three properties. This work will address stream processing systems mechanisms, namely the triggering of window execution, to continuously adapt the Accuracy, Resource usage and Timeliness of window processing to produce results. When provided with strict goals on one of two of these properties, the framework will aim to fulfill them while optimizing the other one(s).

The work will involve taking advantage of approximate processing and load shedding techniques with machine learning and statistics. This will make the framework self-tuning in order to react to changing conditions and different ingestion rates.

supervisors: Helena Sofia Andrade Nunes Pereira Pinto (100%)
title: [Dissertação] Modeling Cognitive Processes : Learning and Reasoning
observations: Esta Tese é para a aluna nº 81524, Isabel Rego Raposo
objectives:
Cognitive Sciences are an interdisciplinary area involving neurosciences, psychology, philosophy, anthropology, biology, linguists and Artificial Intelligence that aims at the scientific study of the mind and its processes. As such it tries to understand the principles of intelligence with the hope that this will lead to better understanding and comprehension of the mind and of learning and to develop intelligent devices.  To achieve that, it studies several different aspects: attention, knowledge representation, language processing, memory, perception, action, consciousness.

In this thesis we aim at the computational modeling of learning and reasoning processes.

In this thesis we begin by an in depth literature study and critical review taking as starting point the last results in current cognitive sciences results.The emphasis is  learning and reasoning, in particular how these processes take place in order to be computationally modeled.

From this literature review, the goal will be in finding an approach that would allow the possible representation/implementation of both processes.

supervisors: Helena Sofia Andrade Nunes Pereira Pinto (50%)
title: [Dissertação] From Words to Sound and Music, a computational creativity approach
observations:
This Thesis is for student 83461: Francisco José Gonçalves Coelho Torres Centeno
The Project will involve meetings with musicians and musicologists (experts on the domain).
objectives:
Sound and Music Generation is an interesting topic of Computational Creativity and Musicology. While the discussion of whether machines can create creative artifacts is heated and fierce we focus on Inspiration: we pick an artifact deemed and widely recognized as highly creative because it was created by a human expert in some artistic form and transform it in an artifact in another artistic field.
In this Thesis we aim at sound and music generation from texts. In this case the starting point are the sound of words in the texts, their phonetics. It also involves the rhythm of the text: for instance the Master Piece of James Joyce, "Ulisses", involves and relies heavily on the phonetics and rhythm of the sentences. This mapping can be more or less complex and may involve substitutions of words/sounds for other words/sounds.
At a deeper and more complex level it can also involve the semantics of words.

First, an overview of existing proposals on sound generation from texts, such as poetry, A PORTUGUESE EPOPEE SEEN THROUGH SOUND,
https://cdv.dei.uc.pt/wp-content/uploads/2017/11/coelho2017portuguese.pdf. will be analyzed. Then solutions based on the phonetics will be explored. These will be further elaborated by the use of genetic algorithms or other techniques suitable for computational creativity.
requirements: This Thesis is for student 83461: Francisco José Gonçalves Coelho Torres CentenoThe Project will involve meetings with musicians and musicologists (experts on the domain).

title: Dissertação; Analytics for Cinematic Virtual Reality
objectives: The goal of the project is to develop a platform for analysis of spatiotemporal data captured when viewing media content (e.g., omnidirectional videos) in head-mounted displays. The use of this platform would allow a better understanding of the User Experience in Virtual Reality; this knowledge could then be used to create new interaction techniques or clarify guidelines for creators of Immersive Media. The complexity of spatiotemporal data is a challenging and rich research space, allowing for multiple approaches (e.g. machine learning, computer vision, etc.) that the student can explore.
requirements: The student should be capable or willing to learn how to develop in Unity (C#) and have background in Computer Vision, machine-learning and/or data analytics techniques. This project will build on existing research experience on 360º Video content and the student will have access to the expertise of the research group.

supervisors: Luís Miguel de Oliveira e Silva (50%)
title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Immersive Scientific Visualization of Plasma Physics Simulation
objectives:
At the Group of Lasers and Plasmas (GoLP) of Instituto de Plasmas e Fusão Nuclear at Instituto Superior Técnico, researchers use Particle-in-Cell (PIC) method-based simulations to model plasma with little or no approximations. PIC simulations solve the smallest scales of the plasma, so simulating large systems (where dynamical scales are much larger than the smallest scales) is computationally demanding. For this reason, these simulations are massively parallel, and run on some of the largest supercomputers available worldwide. These simulations produce multidimensional grid and particle data sets that generally exceed several gigabytes per file, making their analysis and visualization non-trivial.

Thus, the objective of this thesis is produce a platform for scientific visualization of results of the mentioned numerical simulations resorting to virtual reality (VR) experiences. Navigating through these interactive visualizations in VR should be an immersive experience, and provide a completely new way of visualizing and interpreting scientific results. Different VR prototypes will be developed and will show numerical simulations of plasmas in the vicinity of compact astrophysical objects such as neutron stars and black holes, as well as of plasmas produced with intense lasers in the laboratory and used to create compact particle accelerators.

title: Dissertation: Quantum Software Engineering: Validation and Verification
objectives: The goal of this project is to investigate existing, and potentially create new, validation and verification methods for the development of reliable quantum programs. The goal is to contribute to a rigorous and sound foundation with the ultimate goal of supporting future ubiquitous services and data related to Quantum Computing applications to guarantee their dependability.
requirements:
Interested students should:
1. Enjoy programming and learning about new programming languages and technologies
2. Be interested in software engineering and software reliability
3. Be willing to learn new concepts and tools, and to apply them in real-world scenarios

title: Dissertação: Mono2Micro - From a Monolith to Microservices: Metrics refinement
objectives:
The microservices architecture allows the existence of several autonomous agile development teams but result in a distributed system where the aspect of consistency becomes critical, the CAP theorem.

As results of previous MSc thesis, a tool was developed for monolith applications, developed using Spring-Boot and Fénix-Framework, that applies static code analysis to collect which domain entities are accessed by each one of the application's controllers, uses similarity measures to define clusters, and provides a user interface to allow the software developer analyse different partitioning hypothesis.

The goal of this thesis is to extend the existing Mono2Micro to explore new metrics similarity metrics and compare the results of their application with the results obtained so far.
requirements: Study the different qualities associated with a microservices architecture and define metric for each one of these qualities.Compare the results of applying the metrics on the generation of clusters, and analysis their consistency and trade-offs.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Representação de Conhecimento através de Redes Neuronais
objectives:
Esta tese tem como objectivo explorar a utilização de redes neuronais e redes neuronais profundas para representar conhecimento declarativo (como por exemplo frases em Lógica Proposicional e/ou Lógica de Primeira Ordem).  Isso, de acordo com recentes resultados publicados, pode ser realizado com a utilização do espaço latente representado nas camadas escondidas da rede e com operadores neuronais. Pretende-se estender os resultados obtidos com cenários visuais para cenários que utilizem linguagem natural ou declarativa.

Organização

Em termos de organização, o trabalho visa as seguintes etapas: a) Levantamento do estado da arte em aprendizagem neuro-simbólica. b) Aplicação de um algoritmo estado da arte a um cenário geração de narrativa, c) treino de um modelo utilizando várias técnicas d) análise dos resultados;  e) Escrita da tese.
requirements: Recomenda-se a frequência da cadeira de Planeamento, Aprendizagem e Decisão Inteligente

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: PROJETO: Atualização de um analisador morfológico usando transdutores
location: Laboratório de Sistemas de Língua Falada - L2F (INESC-ID Lisboa)
observations: [Esta proposta foi realizada em conjunto com a aluna Nº 75312, Bruno Leitão]
objectives:
O código deve ser reestruturado para que seja de mais eficiente e de mais fácil compreensão/manutenção.
De entre as tarefas a executar, destacam-se: (1) Atualizar das bibliotecas usadas para manipulação de autómatos; (2) Eliminar a dependência da biblioteca FSMTools; (3) paralisar a geração do transdutor para reduzir o tempo necessário à execução da tarefa; (4) Introduzir testes de validação para cada um dos módulos e aumentar o número de mensagens de erro quando ocorre um problema; (5) melhorar o módulo adivinhador; (6) no demonstrador, ativar a procura de palavras com uma determinada terminação; (7) aceitar símbolos UTF8 como (…, €, ‘, “, …); (9) gerar conjunto de testes para testar funcionamento de palavras simples de cada categoria, prefixos sufixos e da cada um dos paradigmas de flexão; (10) Adicionar novos paradigmas de sufixos de nomes derivados a partir de lemas verbais (+mento: espezinhamento; +ção: disfibrilhação; +agem: combustagem); (11) corrigir erros na geração de sufixos.
requirements: O aluno com perfil para este trabalho deve ter obtido classificação superior a 14 na disciplina "Língua Natural" do MEIC.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: GeoPortal de Recursos Digitais no Domínio da Gestão da Água
observations: O aluno selecionado participa num projeto de investigação financiado pela FCT (envolvendo o IST-ID, INESC-ID e a APA S.A.) e poderá ter acesso a uma bolsa de investigação.
objectives:
Este projeto enquadra-se num projecto de investigação FCT envolvendo os parceiros IST, INESC-ID e APA (Agência Portuguesa do Ambiente), e consiste na conceção e desenvolvimento de um portal colaborativo que permita a gestão de recursos digitais do domínio da gestão da água em Portugal.
 
Pretende-se a identificação dos principais stakeholders, processos, e objectivos do domínio da água, bem como a identificação dos principais recursos digitais existentes (i.e., bases de dados ou repositórios de informação), e a sua caracterização através de metadados adequados. Para este efeito deverão ser considerados standards na área, tal como o WaterML 2.0 do Open Geospatial Consortium (OGC).

Particularmente, serão considerados recursos digitais produzidos e mantidos pela APA, nomeadamente no âmbito do seu sistema SNIRH (https://snirh.apambiente.pt/). Serão ainda considerados recursos obtidos através de outras fontes de dados, tais como imagens de satélite e imagens obtidas através de crowdsourcing ou por recuperação de redes sociais, tais como Flickr, Twitter, ou Instagram, com a correspondende extração e classificação automática de etiquetas e metadados (e.g., de localização).

Os recursos digitais mantidos neste sistema deverão providenciar mecanismos de interoperabilidade com aplicações terceiras, nomeadamente com ferramentas de análise e simulação de fenómenos naturais, tais como inundações, tsunamis, ou secas extremas.

Descrição geral do projeto:
Os principais resultados deste projeto serão:
- Conceção do GeoPortal Colaborativo;
- Implementação de uma versão inicial do GeoPortal Colaborativo;
- Implementação de mecanismos de interoperabilidade com ferramentas externas;
- Artigo a submeter a conferência internacional.

--
Keywords: Information Management; Geographic Information; Water; Climate Change.

title: Dissertation: Procedural Generation of Mechanics Progression for Games
objectives:
Procedural Content Generation (PCG), i.e. how game content can be created algorithmically, is an increasingly important area and currently one of the most active topics within the software games industry and game research. A topic that is traditionally left outside of PCG is the generation of a progression of mechanics that will make the game traversal fun. For instance, when considering the progression of a character in a role-playing game, how to automatically create a skill tree that will support best player experience possible? This work will explore how to automatically design progression mechanics for incremental games.

Main sub-goals:
( 1 ) Literature review (semester 1)
( 2 ) Computational model (semester 1 and 2)
( 3 ) Test scenario implementation (semester 2)
( 4 ) User studies (semester 2)
requirements: This thesis proposal is open to all MSc students from the Master Degree in Information Systems and Computer Engineering of Instituto Superior Técnico.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Sistemas de Reputação para detecção de notícias falsas
objectives:
Impulsionado pelas redes sociais e os novos paradigmas de comunicação, o fenómeno das noticias falsas está na ordem do dia. Apenas recentemente se tomou consciência da facilidade com que é possível utilizar as novas plataformas de comunicação, nomeadamente as redes sociais, para influenciar a opinião publica quer com intuitos comerciais quer com intuitos políticos ou militares.

No contexto de um projeto patrocinado pelo programa H2020 da União Europeia (https://eunomia.social/), que visa disponibilizar um mecanismo descentralizado, com base em tecnologia blockchain e em redes de comunicação peer-to-peer, de avaliação pela comunidade dos conteúdos partilhados nas redes sociais, pretende-se desenhar e implementar um protocolo criptográfico para suportar um sistema de votação que permita a um utilizador, votar no conteúdo de uma publicação, imprimindo a sua reputação a esse voto mas mantendo a opção de o fazer de forma anónima.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: (PROJECT) DEI/PhD Information System
objectives:
Context:
At IST, data about Bachelor/Master courses and students is stored and kept by the Fenix system. The system provides several functionalities that enable students, teachers and course coordinators to manage data in an effective way. In what concerns data about PhD courses and students, the Fenix system also gives support but in a limited way. For example, the PhD coordinator has two views of the data regarding a PhD student: one called “PhD processes” where documents regarding the application and student progress can be visualized; and another one where the courses where the student is enrolled can be visualized. The existence of these two views makes it very difficult to manage data, and to obtain statistics about he course (for example, how many students are enrolled, how many have defended their Thesis Proposal in a given period, etc).

Goal:
To develop an information system that, integrated with the Fenix system, can efficiently and effectively support the storage and management of PhD students in a given department (the Computer Science and Engineering Department will be the case study). 
The following sub-goals must be achieved:
• Requirements gathering: through interviews to the different stakeholders: students, supervisors, administrative staff and coordinator
• Design of a well defined API with the Fenix system
• Model and design of a relational database
• Design and implementation of the user interface
• Development of the application

Expected Results:
• Requirements Document
• Prototype of the DEI/PhD Information System to put in production in the Computer Science and Engineering Departament
• Publication of a paper.
requirements:
Students must have:• finished their 3-year degree on Information Systems and Computer Engineering (LEIC) with an average grade >= 14/20 for IST students
• obtained a grade >= 16 in the following 3- year degree courses: Databases, Object-Oriented Programming, Software Engineering, Human-Computer Interaction
• an average grade of the master’s courses so far >= 16/20.

Students must be working full-time on their Master thesis therefore people who are working in a company on a completely different subject will not be accepted.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: The automation of the data science process exploring domain knowledge
objectives:
A automatização dos processos de aprendizagem automática têm ocupado os profissionais da área, sendo no entanto os resultados obtidos francamente fracos.
Dada a importância do tema e a necessidade de explorar conhecimento do domínio para facilitar e melhorar aquela automatização, o presente trabalho visa o desenvolvimento de métodos de parametrização automática mais informados, capazes de focar a procura dos parâmetros em espaços de procura mais promissores.
A par destes métodos, poderão ainda desenvolver-se estratégias de definição de novas variáveis (feature engineering) com base em conhecimento de domínio, extraído diretamente do modelo da(s) base(s) de dados que suporta(m) os dados a analisar.
requirements: Aprovação anterior na disciplina de Ciência de Dados, ou equivalente.

title: Project: IoT Solution for Rental Houses
objectives: O alojamento local, ou arrendamento de curta duração de habitações, teve recentemente uma enorme expansão. O acesso a essas habitações nem sempre é fácil de gerir, especialmente se o dono ou pessoa responsável viver a uma distância significativa, podendo não ser prático ou viável a pessoa deslocar-se propositadamente para fornecer a chave da casa e, posteriormente, recebê-la de volta. Pretende-se desenvolver uma solução IoT (Internet of Things) que, entre outros aspectos, dê suporte à abertura remota da porta da habitação e permita controlar o consumo de energia eléctrica, água e, eventualmente, gás, permitindo ligar e desligar equipamentos remotamente, possibilitando, por exemplo, ligar o aquecimento antes dos clientes chegarem ou assegurar que tudo fica desligado quando os clientes abandonam a habitação. A solução a desenvolver pode recorrer a módulos do tipo "ESP8266" ou "ESP32 WROOM", sendo preferencialmente do tipo web, permitindo acesso por smartphone.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projecto: A framework for large scale phylogenetic analyses
location: IDSS Lab, INESC-ID Lisboa, Rua Alves Redol 9, 1000-029 Lisboa
observations: Bruno Lourenço has already manifested interest in this thesis. External advisor: Cátia Vaz (cvaz@cc.isel.ipl.pt).
objectives: With growing exchanges of people and merchandise between countries, epidemics have became an issue of increasing importance and huge amounts of data are being collected everyday. See for instance http://enterobase.warwick.ac.uk/.  Hence, analyses that were usually run in personal computers and desktops are no longer feasible. It is now common to run such tasks in HPC environments and/or dedicated systems. On the other hand we are often dealing in these analyses with graphs and trees, and running algorithms to find patterns in such structures. Hence, although graph oriented databases and processing systems can be of much help in this setting, as far as we know there is no solution relying on these technologies to address large scale phylogenetic analysis challenge. The aim of this project is then to develop a modular framework for large scale phylogenetic analysis that exploits such technologies. Such framework should allow the representation of large phylogenetic networks and trees, as well as ancillary data, it should support queries on such data, and it should allow the deployment of algorithms for inferring/detecting patterns and for pre-computing visualizations. The framework will be tested with data from http://enterobase.warwick.ac.uk/ and algorithms already available in PHYLOViZ (http://www.phyloviz.net/).
