title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Hybrid Approaches for Spatial Data Interpolation
PROJECT: Infra-RED: A Visual and Flow-based Designer of Smart IT Infrastructures
observations: Thesis Proposal agreed with student Duarte Alves nr. 84591
objectives:
The DevOps "culture" advocates software engineering best practices and tools in order to ensure continuously evolving complex systems, promoting a tight collaboration between the developers (Dev) and the teams that deploy and operate the systems (Ops).

Current solutions and tools lack mechanisms for the ease of Design and for continuous deployment and evolution of the systems across different spaces (from IoT, to edge, core and clouds) as well as for the continuous quality assurance, such as mechanisms to ensure end-to-end security and privacy, and mechanisms to allow continuous testing of IT Infrastructures (within emulated and simulated infrastructures).

At the Network level, the dynamism of Software Defined Networking (SDN) and Network Functions Virtualization (NFV) might even make easier to design, and build infrastructures with more flexible services and capabilities, making possible to link network functions through Service Function Chaining (SFC) to produce new services.

For the continuous deployment and evolution of these systems, the management of the lifecycle of all the different assets is a must, and can be performed through a Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT). This technology can capture all transactions and state changes that occur with an asset of the Infrastructure (hardware, software, and associated contracts), providing a single source of truth (immutable system of record available in near real-time) for the core information about each asset, so that no matter what happened to an asset, all stakeholders and systems would know its status.


This project intends to propose and develop Infra-RED, a Proof-of-Concept toolset to enable trustworthy DevOps in the realm of IT Infrastructures, with (a set of, visual) tool that aims at improving the proper design, the management, the continuous delivery and continuous orchestration of these systems, also ensuring their traceability.


The Infra-RED tool should be able to:
- be a (visual) programming tool, browser-based (e.g., JavaScipt),
- follow Infrastructure-as-Code principles, for wiring together hardware devices, APIs and online services,
- invoke transactions that create, configure, update, and delete assets 
- manage and monitor servers networks and services, and automate sysadmin related tasks,
- visually compare the live IT environment state before and after a deployment, as part of the automated Continuous- Integration/Delivery (CI/CD) pipeline.

A PoC prototype shall be built, deployed and tested. The results obtained shall be validated based on real scenarios to be defined. 


Recommended Tools and frameworks:

- Distributed Ledger Technology (DLT): Hyperledger Fabric (https://www.hyperledger.org/projects/fabric)
- Hyperledger tools: Hyperledger Composer (https://hyperledger.github.io/composer/)
- Container technology: Docker (https://www.docker.com)
- Node-RED: (https://nodered.org)
- SDN Network Emulator: Mininet (http://mininet.org)

title: Dissertation: Blockchain-based secret management in multi-cloud storage platforms
objectives:
Cloud storage services are currently a commodity that allows users to store data persistently, access the data from everywhere, and share it with friends or co-workers. However, due to the proliferation of cloud storage accounts and lack of interoperability between cloud services, managing and sharing cloud-hosted files is a nightmare for many users. To address this problem, specialized cloud aggregator systems emerged that provide users a global view of all files in their accounts and enable file sharing between users from different clouds.

Such systems, however, have limited security: not only they fail to provide end-to-end privacy from cloud providers, but they require users to grant full access privileges to individual cloud storage accounts.

The goal of this thesis is to extend Storekeeper - a privacy preserving cloud aggregation service that enables file sharing on multi-user multi-cloud storage platforms - with a metadata management that ensures security sensitive operation can be performed only on trusted client endpoints.
The resulting system, Crypto Cloud, should leverage blockchain technology to enforce decentralized metadata management in a secure way.

References:
[1] Ethereum - A Next-Generation Smart Contract and Decentralized Application Platform. White Paper. Ethereum team. 2014-17
[2] Hyperledger Fabric: a Distributed Operating System for Permissioned Blockchains. Eurosys 2018.

supervisors: Pedro Manuel Moreira Vaz Antunes de Sousa (50%)
title: Dissertação || IAP4GDPR: Information Architecture Patterns for GDPR compliance
observations: Mais detalhes em  https://sites.google.com/site/vasconcelosandre/teses/mestrado/temas-mestrado
objectives:
Motivação:

A arquitetura informacional tem por objetivo identificar e definir os principais tipos de dados que suportam o desenvolvimento do negócio da organização. 

Através da arquitetura informacional pretende-se ter a descrição das entidades informacionais necessárias à persecução dos processos de negócio da Organização. 
Tipicamente associados ao desenvolvimento de Arquitetura informacional pretende-se:
•	Identificar a informação fundamental ao negócio.
•	Definir os dados de forma independente das aplicações ou sistemas em que irão existir.
•	Fornecer as bases para a gestão dos dados corporativos.
A caracterização detalhada destas entidades informacionais, tendo em consideração as propriedades dos dados e as suas inter-relações, deve-se desenvolver a nível da especificação da Arquitectura dos Sistemas de Informação.
As entidades informacionais de mais alto nível são refinadas, tendo em vista a sua implementação física, em entidades informacionais de mais baixo nível. Este nível arquitectural (da arquitectura informacional) pode ser visto como um desenho (preliminar) do modelo informacional a implementar na base de dados. 

Por outro lado, o Regulamento Geral de Proteção de Dados (RGPD) é o diploma legal que regula o tratamento de dados pessoais de pessoa singulares residentes no território da União Europeia (UE). Este documento traz novidades assinaláveis ao nível dos deveres das organizações e dos direitos dos cidadãos relativamente ao tratamento dos dados pessoais.
O RGPD define os direitos dos titulares dos dados pessoais e os deveres dos responsáveis pelo tratamento desses dados. Designadamente o RGPD estabelece os princípios relativos ao tratamento dos dados pessoais: a lealdade, licitude e transparência do tratamento dos dados pessoais; a limitação das finalidades; a minimização dos dados; a exatidão dos dados; a limitação da conservação; a integridade; e a responsabilidade. Também são estabelecidos os seguintes direitos dos titulares dos dados pessoais: de acesso, ao apagamento, à limitação do tratamento, de portabilidade dos dados, de oposição e de decisões individuais automatizadas (profiling).
De forma a garantir a segurança dos dados pessoais o RGPD implica que as organizações analisem o nível de risco de segurança no tratamento, que avaliem o impacto sobre a proteção de dados (PIA – Privacy Assessment Impact) e que adotem medidas de conformidade para reduzir os riscos.

Com esta tese, pretende-se proceder ao levantamento de arquiteturas informacionais existentes nos sistemas da Administração Pública, em particular no contexto das plataformas tecnológicas transversais disponibilizadas pela AMA e avaliação da sua conformidade com o RGPD e RCM 41/2018 

Descrição:
Nesta investigação, numa primeira fase, pretende-se proceder ao levantamento do estado da arte em termos das metodologias, frameworks e padrões para modelação de arquiteturas informacionais e RGPD.
Numa segunda fase, o aluno inserido em contexto de organismo público de referência, deverá analisar as obrigações impostas pelo RGPD e legislação nacional existente e propor padrões e princípios ao nível da arquitetura informacional para contemplar os requisitos definidos pelo RGPD, incluindo: a identificação das finalidades, a exatidão, a limitação da conservação, a integridade, a responsabilidade, os direitos ao acesso, ao apagamento, à limitação do tratamento, à portabilidade dos dados, à oposição, e profiling.
 
Figura 1 – Exemplo de Classificação de Dados de acordo com a sensibiliade
(fonte: https://bizzdesign.com/blog/8-steps-enterprise-architects-can-take-to-deal-with-gdpr/)
Em seguida o aluno deverá aplicar os padrões e princípios informacionais propostas na melhoria de arquitetura de informação e respetivo modelo de dados a plataforma da AMA. No levantamento e descrição da arquitetura informacional deve ser possivel avaliar a existência de funcionalidades associadas à informação, nos termos do RGPD, nomeadamente a recolha consentimento e comunicação, gerir/atribuir finalidades, prazos de conservação; efetuar categorização, anonimização, encriptação, apagamento, correção e exportação/portabilidade de acordo com os requisitos do RGPD e Resolução de Conselho de Ministros 41/2018.
requirements:
Resultados Esperados:1.: Caracterização de atributos e relações a considerar numa arquitetura informacional
2.	Proposta de parão de arquitetura informacional para suportar requisitos RGPD;
3.	Aplicação de proposta na Administração Pública 
4.     Publicação de artigo.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: [DISERTAÇÃO] Traffic light control using deep reinforcement learning
observations:
In this work, the student will investigate the use of deep reinforcement learning (RL) for traffic light control optimization. Several works have addressed traffic light control using RL [5]. It is possible to classify state-of-the-art RL approaches as falling in one of two categories: 

- Distributed RL approaches that take advantage of rich multi-agent models of traffic and learn distributed policies for traffic flow optimization that are able to incorporate rich traffic patterns, including disruptive events, pedestrians and vehicles [1]. 

- Single-agent deep RL approaches that take advantage of the ability of deep learning architectures (namely convolutional networks) to extract high-level information from complex input data and has focused mostly on learning reactive policies to the traffic conditions [3]. 

This work seeks to combine the best of both categories above. During the work the student is expected to train a network of RL agents [1] building on state-of-the-art RL agent architectures [3, 4]. In particular, the student is expected to investigate distribution-based RL [2] architectures in the context of traffic light control. 

The work will rely on publicly available traffic simulators, such as SUMO (sumo.dlr.de) and Veins (veins.car2x.org) or MATSim (www.matsim.org) and, if available, traffic information from Lisbon Municipality.

References:

[1] M. Aslani, M. Mesgari, M. Wiering. Adaptive traffic signal control with actor-critic methods in a real-world traffic network with different traffic disruption events. Transportation Research Part C: Emerging Technologies, 85:732–752, 2017.

[2] M. Bellemare, W. Dabney, R. Munos. A distributional perspective on reinforcement learning. In Proc. 34th Int. Conf. Machine Learning, pp. 449-458, 2017.

[3] N. Casas. Deep deterministic policy gradient for urban traffic light control. CoRR, abs/1703.09035, 2017.

[4] W. Genders, S. Razavi. Using a deep reinforcement learning agent for traffic signal control. CoRR, abs/1611.01142, 2016. 

[5] M. Wiering, J. van Veenen, J. Vreeken, A. Koopman. Intelligent traffic light control. Technical Report UU-CS-2004-029, University Utrecht, 2004a.
requirements: The student should be comfortable with machine learning and reinforcement learning basics, as provided in courses such as PADI and Aprendizagem.

title: Dissertação: Multivariate time-series forecasting of seafood safety
observations: The work will be supported by a strong collaboration network between INESC-ID, IT and IPMA.
objectives: Seafood species act as vectors of harmful algal bloom (HAB) toxins in marine food webs. The Portuguese Institute of the Sea and Atmosphere (IPMA) has in place a monitoring program for marine toxic phytoplankton and contamination of shellfish along the Portuguese coast. Whenever toxin levels exceed the safety limits, shellfish harvesting is temporarily banned as a precautionary approach to ensure public health safety. Prohibitions to shellfish harvesting, in turn, frequently lead to significant economic losses in the shellfish industry. The aim of this proposal is to develop mathematical and bioinformatics tools to forecast spatial and temporal occurrence of harmful blooms and shellfish contamination, based on multivariate time series of in situ measured toxin concentration in shellfish and toxic phytoplankton biomass in sea water, and remotely sensed data on sea surface temperature and salinity.
requirements: Interest in machine learning and good implementation skills. It is preferred, although not mandatory, that students are knowledgeable about algorithms and data structures, object oriented programming, artificial intelligence and optimization. Students with good marks in courses related with the thesis topics will be preferred. Minimum average mark required: 15 (Bachelor).

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertation: Automatic Nativeness Assessment
observations:
Dissertação realizada em ambiente Empresarial
Co-orientador externo: João Freitas (luis.ribeiro@pdmfc.com)
objectives:
Crowdsourcing platforms need to know the proficiency of users in a given language. This can be achieved by language tests but their content is expensive to create, manage and maintain. Also, language tests need to be refreshed on a regular basis and they are often disclosed. As an alternative one can apply machine learning to assess user’s proficiency in a given language via text, speech or both.
DefinedCrowd (http://www.definedcrowd.com/) is a Luso-American start-up that offers to their clients an intelligent platform for collecting, enriching and transforming data to be used for training Artificial Intelligence (AI) systems. 
In this MSc project, the student will investigate, develop and evaluate methods for the automatic assessment of the degreee of nativeness of a speaker. The estimation of the degree of nativeness will be based on the analysis of unrestricted speech productions. This analysis may consider acoustic, prosodic and phonetic cues directly extracted from the speech signal, but also linguistic cues obtained from automatic transcriptions.

title: Dissertation: Dissertation: Visual Servoing and Grasping Using Learning Methods
location: ISR/IST’s Intelligent Robots and Systems group (http://welcome.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/labs/irsgroup/) - Torre Norte
observations: The MSc thesis will be developed within the framework of the SocRob@Home project and team (https://irsgroup.isr.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/projects/socrob-home/), under which ISR/IST participates regularly in international robot competitions, such as RoboCup@Home (http://www.robocupathome.org) and European Robotics League (ERL) - Consumer Service Robots (https://eu-robotics.net/robotics_league/erl-consumer/about/index.html).
objectives:
Visual Servoing and Grasping by a robot manipulator is a well-studied problem, which has been researched and developed for at least thirty years. It includes recognising and determining the location of an object in an image, tracking moving objects,  and move the end-effector of a robot manipulator to approach, follow and grasp the object. This control problem can be modelled mathematically using well-known approaches for a combination of cases, e.g., when the camera moves with the arm or not, when the error between end-effector and object is measured in the image frame or in the world frame. In practice, some issues arise: the arm/camera callibration; handling redundant manipulators; mobile manipulation (where the arm move on the top of a mobile platform), among others. In such cases, determining the required mathematical models can be very hard or subject to several approximations to make the problem tractable. Modern learning methods can be used to estimate such models and improve the visual servoing and grasping process.
This thesis will start by studying and implementing some established methods in visual servoing and catching, identifying problems that can benefit of incorporating learning methods. Those will be developed and tested in comparison with the more classic ones.
The developed work will be applied in case studies with a mobile manipulator.
requirements: Proficient programming skills in C++/Python are required. Good knowledge of ROS is a strong plus.

title: Dissertação: Automatic User Interface (UI) Generation
observations:
Esta tese será realizada em colaboração com a empresa Outsystems.

O co-orientador pela Outsystems Hugo Veiga (hugo.veiga@outsystems.com)
objectives: Automatic User Interface (UI) generation has recently been building momentum in software development. Traditionally, building UI is known to be a very tedious task, detail driven and prone to error. Machine Learning is being used to greatly accelerate frontend development by using more data and algorithms, and less coding. Live sketch to UI mapping allows the developer to obtain immediate feedback on what's being generated and allows changes to be made on the fly. For this work we are aiming at the creation of models that would detect UI components from sketches and build LIVE UIs, ready to be re-designed at will. These detected components would be mapped to an internal library of UI components which is constantly evolving, presenting one-shot learning problems.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Patch security smells in infrastructure code scripts
objectives:
Software bugs cost developers and software companies a great deal of time and money. For example, in 2014, a bug in a widely used SSL implementation (”goto fail”) caused it to accept invalid SSL certificates. Such bugs are often statically detectable and are, in fact, obvious upon reading the code or documentation yet still make it into production software. Static analysis is one of the main techniques used to detect this kind of problems automatically. However, one of the main reasons for developers/companies not to use static analyzers is because of their lack of action upon finding security vunerabilities. The aim of this project is to implement a tool that automatically repairs 3-4 different types of security smells in code scripts: admin by default, use of weak crypto algorithms, use of HTTP without TLS, and more.

Goals:
1. Study patch generation techniques (symbolic execution, genetic programming, etc).
2. Explore SLIC tool (or ESLint) presented in the Seven Sins paper.
3. Create/leverage/adapta technique to repair automatically 3-4 security smells of the Seven Sins paper.
4. Try the technique on a subset of the dataset used in the Seven Sins paper and report the results.

References:
• The Seven Sins: Security Smells in Infrastructure as Code Scripts (2019). In International Conference in Software Engineering.
requirements: 1. Experience/interest in PHP/JScript2. Interest in Software Engineering and Security

title: Dissertaçao: Network Protocols for Stream Processing on Low-Cost FPGAs in Space Systems
location: INESC-ID, Alameda Campus (Rua Alves Redol, 9 - 1000-029 Lisboa)
observations:
Prof. Orientadores:
Rui Duarte (rui.duarte@tecnico.ulisboa.pt,) Tel: 213100251
objectives:
SpaceWire is a standard for high-speed links and networks for use onboard spacecraft, easing the interconnection of: sensors, mass-memories, processing units, and down-link telemetry sub-systems.
This protocol is usually implemented in expensive radiation hardened devices, which exhibit lower computational power than newer and cheaper devices, therefore it is of great interest to explore the implementation of network protocols applied in space on such devices.
The objective of this thesis is to investigate the applicability of this communication standard to low-cost FPGAs, demonstrate its implementation and discuss performance results.

More info on SpaceWire:
http://spacewire.esa.int

This thesis is related to a research project running now at INESC-ID, SARRROCA:
https://web.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/ist14551/projs/sarrroca/
requirements: Dá-se preferência a quem tenha média de curso superior a 14 valores e queira fazer a disciplina de IPEEC.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projecto: Simulador de Cache
objectives:
Conceber e realizar um simulador de cache para apoiar o ensino de arquitectura de computadores.

Apesar de estarem disponíveis várias aplicações para simulação de hierarquias de memória (caches) - por exemplo, dinero - tem-se verificado que estas não têm um impacto a nível da aprendizagem tão relevante quanto seria desejável. Por isso pretende-se conceber e realizar um simulador de caches que não só forneça os indicadores de desempenho comuns neste tipo de simuladores (hit/miss rate) mas que também permita fazer a análise temporal simplificada dos acessos através da cache, apresentando de forma simples e intuitiva a sequência de passos encadeados no acesso do processador à hierarquia de memória.

Deverá ser possível definir as principais características da cache - dimensão, associatividade, blocos, políticas de escrita, substituição, carregamento), caches multinível e caches vítimas, mapeamento de zonas de endereçamento cacheable/non cacheable. Deverá igualmente ser possível definir, de forma simplificada, as características temporais da cache - tempo de hit, tempo de acesso à memória, tempos de carregamento e blocos.

supervisors: António Paulo Teles de Menezes Correia Leitão (100%)
title: Dissertation: Interactiveness in Architecture
observations: Este tema destina-se à aluna Catarina São Miguel de Castro Brás.
objectives:
The traditional CAD/BIM tools used in Architecture do not typically support
realistic navigation in the 3D model of a building. Similarly, they do not
support interaction with the building elements, such as opening doors, 
using escalators, lifts, etc. However, this ability would add an extra level of
realism to the architectural visualization process, particularly, when
combined with virtual reality.

The goal of this thesis is the study and implementation of interaction 
mechanisms for architectural visualization in the context of Algorithmic
Design, which supports the generation of buildings through algorithms

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Locus of Control Vis - Visualização Adaptável Consoante a Personalidade
objectives: O Lócus de Controlo é a expectativa do indivíduo sobre a medida em que os fatores que determinam os resultados de acontecimentos na sua vida vem de fatores internos (esforço pessoal, competência, etc.) ou externos (as outras pessoas, sorte, destino, etc.). O impacto que este aspeto psicológico tem na interação com uma visualização. O objetivo desta tese é estudar e compreender este cenário em que a “visualização nos segue”, mostrando a cada momento o que é mais relevante para a nossa interação com os dispositivos ao nosso redor. Escolhido um cenário concreto, explorar quais as melhores formas de visualizar informação relevante para esse cenário.
requirements: Frequência da disciplina da Visualização de Informação: Não obrigatório mas preferencial.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: [Dissertation] Regulation and Value Alignment for Artificial Intelligence Systems
observations:
- Motivation -
This creates a very hard scientific challenge of ensuring that the A.I. agent will act rationally from the point of view of its owner, i.e. has its values aligned with its owner. This problem has been called the value alignment problem \cite{shapiro2002valuealignment}, ''how can we ensure that a machine behaves according to an ethical framework even in situation not considered by its owner or developer''.

Two main ideas can be followed to try to solve the (individual) value alignment problem. We could try to specify all the values of a person, or we could try to learn those values from the behavior. The first approach cannot solve the problem because it is very hard to specify everything, the second approach will also have problems in that we might never have enough data, or the data is biased \cite{smith2016bigdata}, but it can provide more and more approximate solutions with more experience. Probably a data driven approach considering some general specification will provide better results by creating strong inductive bias that will simplify the learning problem. Again, if solving the value alignment problem for an AGI is out of reach for now, as it is AGI, solving the value alignment problem for many of the near future systems might be doable.

- Goals -
In this thesis we will explore the value alignment problem in societies.

- References -

1.: Hadfield-Menell, D., Russell, S. J., Abbeel, P., & Dragan, A. (2016). Cooperative inverse reinforcement learning. In Advances in neural information processing systems (pp. 3909-3917).
2.	Milli, S., Hadfield-Menell, D., Dragan, A., & Russell, S. (2017). Should robots be obedient?. arXiv preprint arXiv:1705.09990.
3.	Hadfield-Menell, D., Dragan, A., Abbeel, P., & Russell, S. (2016). The off-switch game. arXiv preprint arXiv:1611.08219. 
4.	Martin A Nowak, Karen M Page, and Karl Sigmund. Fairness versus reason in the ultimatum game. Science, 289(5485):1773{1775, 2000.
5.	Daniel Shapiro and Ross Shachter. User-agent value alignment. In Proc. of The 18th Nat. Conf. on Artif. Intell. AAAI, 2002.
objectives:
During the thesis work, the student is expected to:
•	Learn about preferences, utilities and value for artificial intelligence
•	Learn how machines infer utilities from data
•	Get acquainted with the problems of specifying values
•	Learn about the problems of value alignment
•	Develop new algorithms with better value alignment properties
requirements: The student needs to have very good programming skills, knowledge of machine learning methods, specially reinforcement learning, and interest in novel machine learning approaches.

title: [Dissertação] Parallel NF Synthesis
observations: This project will be advised by Luis Pedrosa (new Professor at DEI, starting September 2019)
objectives:
Recent work has been exploring software network functions (NFs), a collection of techniques that enable processing packets entirely in software, allowing commodity servers to replace inflexible network equipment. Processing packets at line-rate has been a challenge, but recent techniques like kernel-bypass have enabled packet processing at throughputs of 10s of Gbit/s and latencies of 100s of ns. Developing NFs with this kind of performance can be quite challenging though, as every nanosecond counts at this scale.
One technique to improve throughput is Receive Side Scaling (RSS), which spreads packet processing across multiple CPU cores. The NIC is configured to hash a given set of fields of the packet and use the hash-value to select the CPU core that should process the packet. Getting this right in practice is a challenge however. Once cores contend for access to shared state the overhead of ensuring consistent access to memory, both at the application level (locks or lock-free data-structures) and the CPU cache (cache coherence), often outweighs the gains of parallelism. A naive parallel implementation can end up being slower than its sequential counterpart.
Recent work in verifying NFs [1], explored using symbolic analysis to build a sound and complete representation of the entire behavior of an NF. In that case, this representation was used to check the behavior against a specification for correctness but, in this thesis, we propose using it to synthesize a parallel version of it using RSS. This raises three basic challenges: how to preserve sequential semantics across packets, how to generate code that runs efficiently and actually benefits from the parallelism, and how to balance the gains of assigning more or fewer cores to the NF, as opposed to other useful work on the machine.
Our specific goal is to build a static analysis tool that analyzes the NF code and determines which fields allow for an optimal sharding, i.e. allow each core to operate as independently as possible. Subsequently, the system should generate a new version of the NF that automatically sets up RSS and mediates any state coordination if still necessary.

References:
[1] A. Zaostrovnykh et al., A Formally Verified NAT, SIGCOMM'17

title: Project: Innovative mobile interfaces for healthcare and wellbeing
observations:
Plano de atividades:
•: Elaboração do estado arte
•	Análise das necessidades específicas da área de saúde e bem-estar
•	Definição de storyboard
•	Desenvolvimento do protótipo
•	Avaliação dos resultados com utilizadores reais  
•	Elaboração da tese

Tecnologias usadas:
•	Tecnologias mobiles para IOS, Android ou ambos
objectives:
Desenvolver um protótipo de aplicação mobile (IOS, Android ou ambos) que permita a um utilizador registar vários indicadores (ex: biométricos e estilo de vida) e permita uma interação utilizador – máquina adequada as características do individuo (health personalization) e de acordo com as necessidades específicas da área da saúde e bem-estar.
De uma forma genérica já existe bastante investigação na área do user interface, incluindo mobile interfaces. Não obstante a área de saúde e bem-estar incorpora desafios próprios, que carecem de transmissão de empatia, compreensão e personalização, sendo que o último ponto envolve a adequação as características do individuo/utilizador. Esta tese será focada nestes desafios.

title: Dissertation: Computationally Constructed Emotions for Non-Player Characters in Games
objectives: Affective Computing (AC) is the field of Artificial Intelligence that studies the recognition, interpretation, processing and simulation of human affect. Although emotions are commonly thought of as discrete and distinct, and as having specific circuits in the brain, an approach traditionally framing most computational models of emotions in the field of AC, the theory of constructed emotions, which posits that affect is based on interoceptive predictions about the state of the body that produce basic affective feelings, provides a different possible explanation. This works will explore a computational model based on the theory of constructed emotion in the context of digital games. More specifically, it will explore how a model based on anticipation could be more appropriate to control the generation of emotions for non-player characters (NPC) in games.
requirements: This thesis proposal is open to all MSc students from the Master Degree in Information Systems and Computer Engineering of Instituto Superior Técnico.

title: Dissertação: Multiresolution Hopfield Network and Simulated Annealing
objectives:
A Hopfield network is a form of recurrent artificial neural network popularized by John Hopfield in 1982, but described earlier by Little in 1974]Hopfield nets serve as content-addressable memory systems with binary threshold nodes. They are guaranteed to converge to a local minimum, but will sometimes converge to a false pattern (wrong local minimum) rather than the stored pattern (expected local minimum). Hopfield networks also provide a model for understanding human memory.” Wikipedia

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hopfield_network

Investigate the "energy", E, of the network in relation to the resolution

We will investigate a multi-resolution Hopfield Network using either OR or AND aggregation to store patterns. We will preform empirical experiments. (MATLAB or Mathematica or Python) and compare it with the Simulated Annealing Aproach

Joao Sacramento and Andreas Wichert: Tree-like hierarchical associative memory structures, Neural Networks, 24 (2): 143-147, 2011
requirements: Machine Learning, Love of Mathematics

title: Projeto: Architecting the e-CMR Platform
observations: Assigned to Stanislav Gusakov.
objectives:
The CMR transport document (also known as CMR Consignment Note) is an international consignment note used by drivers, operators and forwarders alike that govern the responsibilities and liabilities of the parties to a contract for the carriage of goods. CMR stands for ”Convention relative au contrat de transport international de marchandises par route”. It has been ratified by most European states, as well as several other countries. Goods companies, drivers and those receiving shipments use a CMR consignment note, which presents information about the shipped goods and the transporting and receiving parties.
In February 2008, a protocol was added to the CMR Convention, which requested that CMR could be managed electronically, via ‘e-CMR’.
This protocol entered into force on 5 June 2011 and was officially launched in January 2017 with the first ever border crossing to use electronic
consignment notes between Spain and France, proving that the system works and is simple to implement and use. It is likely to prompt other countries to join – therefore increasing the potential for common benefit.
In this thesis we intend to define the software architecture of a e-CMR platform with the objective to offer the related functionalities to multiple clients all over the world, allowing seamless integration across existing products.
requirements: Use of software architecture techniques and patterns to identify the stakeholders needs, and define a set of functional and non-functional requirements for an e-CMR platform.Use of metrics to evaluate the quality of the proposed solution.

title: Dissertation: Tension-based Procedural Generation in Games
objectives:
Tension and release are important concepts in Game Design. Their modulation over time drives multiple dimensions of play: gameplay, story, soundtrack, visuals, among others. Although these concepts have such an importance, they rarely are explicitly and simultaneously included in the multiple dimensions of the procedural content generation process. This work will develop a procedurally generated simple game, through a process in which tension and release modulate different parallel gameplay systems, and study the impact of the different modulations in the player's experience.

Main sub-goals:
( 1 ) Literature review (semester 1)
( 2 ) Computational model (semester 1 and 2)
( 3 ) Test scenario implementation (semester 2)
( 4 ) User studies (semester 2)
requirements: This thesis proposal is open to all MSc students from the Master Degree in Information Systems and Computer Engineering of Instituto Superior Técnico.

title: [DISSERTAÇÃO] A deep reinforcement learning approach to dynamic portfolio optimization
observations:
In this work, the student will investigate the use of deep reinforcement learning (RL) for dynamic portfolio optimization. Dynamic portfolio optimization is a sequential decision problem in which a trader must decide, at each time step, how to allocate its funds between a number of possible financial products in order to maximize its profit. 

Several works have addressed different variants of dynamic portfolio optimization using RL. For example, early approaches focused on trading fixed position sizes in a fixed security/asset [1, 4]. Recent works started exploring deep RL approaches [2]. Several works have also explored actual dynamic portfolio optimization [3].

A recent work [5] proposed a complex architecture for dynamic portfolio optimization that combines elements of model-free RL, model-based RL, and supervised learning. In particular,

- The actual agent uses an actor-critic architecture based on DDPG (model-free RL);
- The system uses expert actions to bias the learning of the actor component (supervised learning);
- It also builds a predictive model for synthetic data and state generation (model-based RL).

However, the results were somewhat inconclusive, in that it is not clear the impact of each component of the architecture to the overall performance of the system. This thesis will investigate the advantages/disadvantage of the different types of learning in this domain. 

References:

[1] M. Dempster, V. Leemans. An automated FX trading system using adaptive reinforcement learning. Expert Systems with Applications, 30(3):543-552, 2006.

[2] Y. Deng, F. Bao, Y. Kong, Z. Ren, Q. Dai. Q. Deep direct reinforcement learning for financial signal representation and trading. IEEE Trans. Neural Networks and Learning Systems, 28(3):653-664, 2017.

[3] Y. Guo, X. Fu, Y. Shi, M. Liu. Robust log-optimal strategy with reinforcement learning. CoRR, abs/1805.00205, 2018.

[4] J. Moody, M. Saffell. Learning to trade via direct reinforcement. IEEE Trans. Neural Networks, 12(4):875-889, 2001.

[5] P. Yu, J. Lee, I. Kulyatin, Z. Shi, S. Dasgupta. Model-based deep reinforcement learning for dynamic portfolio optimization. CoRR, abs/1901.08740, 2019.
requirements: The student should be comfortable with machine learning and reinforcement learning basics, as provided in courses such as PADI and Aprendizagem.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: análise de imagem com redes neuronais profundas para suporte aos técnicos de redes móveis
objectives:
Num ambiente extremamente competitivo, os operadores móveis têm orientado os seus esforços para a automatização e digitalização dos seus processos. Este tese será feita em colaboração com a Streambow, que tem acesso aos dados de treino.

A Streambow desenvolve várias soluções de automatização de processos, que disponilizam aos técnicos no terreno, informação atualizada de planeamento de rede relativa a estações base, informação de segurança, performance e alarmística, bem como sistemas automáticos de validação de  redes, utilizando somente  um smartphone ou tablet.
 
Neste contexto, a introdução de soluções de aprendizagem automática profunda aplicadas ao reconhecimento de imagem são de extrema importância para identificação de erros e apoio aos técnicos na identificação dos equipamentos e suas especificidades, para melhor instalação ou manutenção dos mesmos. 

Por exemplo, através de uma foto que o técnico tirou, a antena é imediatamente identificada como uma antena XXX  modelo 80010666, com 4 entradas, funcionando nas frequências de 698-960 MHz e  1710-2690MHz, além de outras especificações da antena, assim como detalhes da cabelagem. 

A presente tese tem os seguintes objetivos para serem cumpridos: 
1.	Reconhecimento visual inteligente dos equipamentos disponíveis no site para apoiar o técnico na instalação e manutenção.
2.	Fornecimento inteligente de todos os detalhes sobre o equipamento identificado pelas fotos do local.
3.	Análise inteligente de tickets no histórico para suporte na resolução de problemas.
4.	Deteção inteligente de falhas de instalação da cabelagem e equipamentos.
5.	Deteção inteligente de documentação sem qualidade adequada para registo dos detalhes da estação base e eliminação de informação duplicada.

O sistema será desenvolvido com base numa tecnologia de redes neuronais profundas, como TensorFlow ou Pytorch.
requirements: Conhecimentos e interesse em desenvolver competências em aprendizagem automática, com foco em redes neuronais profundas.

title: Projecto - TrackIt! - Play it!
observations:
Os trilhos GPS recolhidos são normalmente apresentados de forma estática, tornando difícil que o utilizador possa perceber o movimento.
Igualmente, as características de suavidade e continuidade são essenciais para que o utilizador possa apreciar a visualização da animação.
objectives:
Desenvolver e aplicar técnicas para animação de trilhos registados por GPS controlando os parâmetros de tempo por forma obter animações fluidas e suaves, independentemente da discretização original dos trilhos.
As soluções implementadas deverão permitir a exportação de animações para visualizares externos (GoogleEarth, p.ex.)
Integração das soluções desenvolvidas na aplicação TrackIt! já existente.

http://hawking.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/brisson/Dissertacao/19-20/TrackIt(PlayIt).pdf
requirements: WebGL / Three.jsProgramação com Objectos, Java

title: Projeto: Wearable Monitoring System
objectives:
Pretende-se desenvolver um sistema "wearable" que permita monitorizar uma pessoa na vertente física e fisiológica. A monitorização física pode identificar, por exemplo, se a pessoa está imóvel há demasiado tempo ou se caiu, podendo gerar alarmes. Esta vertente pode ser especialmente útil no caso de pessoas idosas que vivem sózinhas. A monitorização fisiológica pode envolver a aquisição de sinais vitais como batimento cardíaco ou actividade cerebral, o que pode também ser muito útil para pessoas que sofrem de determinados tipos de doenças mas que, devidamente monitorizados, podem permanecer nas suas habitações.
Será implementado um protótipo tendo por base, por exemplo, um arduino, sensores diversos (giroscópio / acelerómetros, batimento cardíaco, etc) e um módulo rádio (por ex., Bluetooth Low Energy) através do qual a informação capturada poderá ser enviada para outro sistema para processamento e arquivo.

title: [Dissertação] Analyzing Transactional Consistency
observations: This project will be advised by Luis Pedrosa (new Professor at DEI, starting September 2019), and co-advised by Rodrigo Rodrigues.
objectives:
Full serializability in transactional data-stores comes at the cost of latency and availability so recent work has been exploring weaker transaction consistency models that improve performance [1]. Implementing such systems can be a challenge however and bugs may creep in which inadvertently break the consistency model or enforce it by conservatively sacrificing too much performance.
In this thesis we will build a static analysis tool to help find such bugs or, in some cases, prove their absence. Consistency models are often described through what is known as litmus tests, simple test transactions whose results may differ based on the underlying consistency model. The idea would be to collect a library of such litmus tests for each different consistency model, forming a hierarchy. We will then build a tool to automatically explore the behavior of the data-store against these tests and determine which consistency models actually hold. The same analysis will also characterize the worst-case performance for each transaction and flag any discrepancies for the developer with any necessary context to aid in debugging the issue.

References:
[1] Bailis, et al., “Highly Available Transactions: Virtues and Limitations”, VLDB’13

supervisors: Pedro Manuel Moreira Vaz Antunes de Sousa (100%)
specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projeto: Integration of Business Process Views
observations: Dissertação proposta  pela aluna Joana  Ribeiro  (83779)
objectives:
Nas organizações reais, os processos de negócio são normalmente definidos levantados por diferentes stakeholders, naturalmente cada um com necessidade específicas. Entre os stakeholders de processos de negócio mais tradicionais numa organização temos:
•	Departamento de Qualidade. Trata-se dos processos de negócio modelados de forma a evidenciar o cumprimento das normas ISO 9001. 
•	Departamento Financeiro. Trata-se de uma visão de processos de Negócio que permita a realização de custeio, ou seja saber quanto custa cada atividade realizada.
•	Departamento de Risco. Usa uma visão dos processos de negócio como forma de categorização dos riscos associados ao negócio da organização.
•	Departamento de Auditoria. Precisa dos processos de negócio para perceber o que deve ser auditado, quando e como. Em algumas “raras” organizações, este procedimento faz parte da qualidade, mas na vasta maioria é um procedimento interno e autónomo da certificação ISO 9001.
•	Departamento de negócio propriamente dita, que usa os processos não só para medir o desempenho da sua unidade, através de indicadores, mas também como forma de gestão de conhecimento entre os colaboradores da unidade.
•	Departamento de informática, no qual os processos de negócio são fundamentalmente a sequência de atividades a automatizar.

Para cada uma destas visões temos formas diferentes de pensar processos, formas diferentes de pensar o que são atividades e também diferentes níveis de detalhe necessário. Tudo isto resulta que, naturalmente existem diferentes visões de processos da mesma organização, frequentemente tão díspares que se tornam inconciliáveis entre si.

Com esta dissertação pretende-se aplicar e explorar os princípios de modelação de processos “multi dimensionais” que suportem um único modelo de processos para todos os stakeholders da organização ao problema da geração de vistas de processos de negócio, adequadas a cada stakeholder.

Concretamente pretende-se desenvolvir uma solução /método para o problema da consolidação/integração de diferentes vistas de um processo num modelo de processo consolidado
requirements: Integration of Business Process Views

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: (Dissertação) Digital Identity with Blockchain
location: INOV INESC Inovação - Rua Alves Redol, 9 - 7º andar
observations:
Para mais informações sff mande um mail para mms@tecnico.ulisboa.pt

Tese realizada em ambiente empresarial.
objectives:
The objectives for this master thesis are the following: describe the problem and propose and evaluate a solution. The problem should be defined, and the value of a solution justified. The solution should be a design research artefact (constructs, models, methods, or instantiations) that requires knowledge of theory. The evaluation should be based on a demonstration that solves one or more instances of the problem.

Identifying a person safely and securely on the Internet is a challenge, specially for critical applications such as banking and healthcare. No wonder that most banks still require new customers to visit a branch in order to open a bank account. However, not only most services are moving online but also it is becoming more and more difficult (and thus expensive) to provide physical offices where customers can go in person, for example, in the case of online banks or even for telemedicine in remote areas. In this thesis the student will develop an application based on blockchain to easily identify a person on the internet that is safe and secure enough for opening a bank account. This year another student already built a first prototype, so the challenge for this thesis will be to evaluate the application in a pilot with real-world users.
requirements: The student must dedicate at least three full working days per week to the thesis, and manage the thesis as a project using Scrum.

title: Dissertação: Automated Computational Complexity Estimation
objectives:
Computational complexity is an important characteristics of a program. Nevertheless, programmers
often do not perform a precise analysis of their programs or might make incorrect assumptions about
their complexity. This is especially true for inexperienced programmers. The objective is to develop a
novel tool that evaluates a given program and provides an estimate of its time complexity.

title: Dynamic stable business processes operation for cybersecurity enforcement using Atlas
observations:
Referências a trabalho prévio:
Marques, R., Guerreiro, S. (2016). Mecanismo de controlo para a frente orientado ao risco como garantia da conformidade da execução de processos de negócio, accepted for Revista Ibérica de Sistemas e Tecnologias de Informação (RISTI), 20, pp. 34{47, DOI: 10.17013/risti.20.34-47, ISSN: 1646- 9895, https://goo.gl/vn3Uy0. Q3 SCImago.
--------------

Aluno: Paulo Sanchéz Lemos Alves
Número: 83538
objectives:
An organization encompasses a network of people and machines working, and communicating, in an integrated way that produces large amounts of data. The organizational activity could be divided in three intervals in time: the ex-ante - what happens before execution, the ex-dure - during execution and the ex-post - after executing events.
Ex-ante includes the modeling skills, e.g., business processes modeling, To-Be Enterprise Architecture (EA) models definition. Disparate specification languages are usually used: Archimate, BPMN, UML, SysML, etc. Ex-dure includes the ability to support the operation directly from the ex-ante models definition, e.g., ontological execution machines. In general terms, this ability is related with Model-Driven Development (MDD). Ex-post includes the decision making processes to estimate future behavior from the available data from the past executions, e.g., Decision trees, Process mining, Data mining, etc.

The integration of these three intervals in time offer a full description of the organizational behavior control: what we want to execute, the support for the operational environment founded directly by the model definitions, and a final analysis and action about (non)compliance situations. Organizational control is understood as the set of artifacts that are able to prescribe, observe and act in the reality, which impacts the behavior of the organization and that is able to change its shape and its performance. This definition, and the supporting theoretical concepts, is broad enough to be applicable to various real-time applications, security for instance.

One specific organizational control application that has been researched extensively, both in the engineering and management area, is the business processes compliance [10]. It encompasses the ability to check whether ex-ante business processes models are followed in ex-dure by its instances, and then act with a change or an enhancement in ex-post. Where a business process is performed by actors, aims at producing a new service or product, demands an event-based behavior modeling that orchestrate the communication between actors, and uses resources, e.g., information, time, etc. 

However, most of the business processes compliance solutions consider that ex-dure is fully known. In reality, due to many design and operational reasons, organizations have an incomplete understanding of ex-dure, and nevertheless, organizational ex-post decisions based on partial information must be taken. This problem is recognized with high impact in the industries of cybersecurity, healthcare, financial, public administration, etc. 
Therefore, the goal of this project is to solve the problem of how to design, implement and manage business processes compliance solutions that are operating in environments with cybersecurity concerns.

Resultados Esperados: 
1. Levantamento de Estado da Arte
2. Proposta de modelo conceptual que integre os modelos de representação de processos de negócio e os mecanismos de compliance (incluindo a observação parcial, a solução para a decisão e a tomada de acções de controlo).
3. Avaliação do modelo conceptual, usando design science research (DSR). 
4. Publicação de artigo
requirements: Disciplinas de sistemas de informação

title: Dissertação || HELP: HEuristics’ Library for Programs, Projects and Portfolios alignment
observations:
Mais detalhes em  https://sites.google.com/site/vasconcelosandre/teses/mestrado/temas-mestrado 

Proposto  por Aluno: André da Silva Mesquita Nº Aluno: 75788
objectives:
Motivação: 
O alinhamento entre a estratégia da organização e o seu portfólio de projetos é uma problemática que tem acompanhado a evolução da investigação em torno da temática dos projetos nas organizações. 
Por outro lado a motivação para toda a arquitetura empresarial é central para a sua correta definição. Esta temática é tradicionalmente abordada em áreas de gestão; no entanto, são normalmente, ignorados o impactos nos vários níveis da arquitetura empresarial. 
Apesar de existirem abordagens tem contribuído para a sistematização das motivações organizacionais não é ainda possível avaliar face a uma dada estratégia e objetivos, quais os projetos, programas mais adequados no contexto da Arquitetura Empresarial da organização.

Descrição:

Nesta dissertação o aluno começará por proceder ao Levantamento do estado da arte da 1) Estratégia Organizacional, incluindo as principais ferramentas, abordagens, frameworks e boas práticas (ao nível da engenharia e da gestão) e dos 2) programas, projetos e portfolio. Este levantamento deverá incluir frameworks de modelação de arquitetura empresarial, de estratégia, metodologias, e ferramentas de modelação de arquitetura empresarial (incluindo Archimate e Motivation extension; Framework; TOGAF; UML, BPMN; BMM; UAF). O aluno deverá ainda proceder-se ao levantamento de métricas, padrões e heurísticas que possibilitem a mensuração de qualidades na arquitetura empresarial (e.g., fiabilidade, disponibilidade, performance, segurança, etc).

Tendo por base uma framework de arquitetura empresarial o aluno deve proceder construção de uma biblioteca de heurísticas de avaliação do alinhamento da estratégia organizacional, arquitetura empresarial e projetos, programas e portfolio.
Em seguida deve ser implementada da biblioteca de heurísticas em ferramenta de Arquitetura Empresarial (E.g., Archi, Enterprise Architect, Atlas, ou outro).

Finalmente a biblioteca de heurísticas deverá ser aplicada na avaliação do alinhamento entre projetos, programas, portfolios, e estratégia no contexto da arquitetura empresarial de uma organização que tem a seu cargo a produção de bens e serviços fundamentais ao funcionamento do Estado Português.
requirements:
Resultados Esperados:1. Proposta de biblioteca de heurísticas para avaliação o alinhamento de Programas, Projetos, e Portfolios no contexto da arquitetura empresarial.
2. Implementação de protótipo de biblioteca de heurísticas em ferramenta de arquitetura empresarial
3. Publicação de artigo.

title: Dissertation: Automatic Bug Finding of JavaScript Applications in the Wild
objectives:
Static analysis tools are becoming increasingly adopted by industry, as they can be used to detect bugs in source code before the code ships.

The goal of this project is to explore static analysis tools and techniques for Javascript code. The goal is to implement new static analyses that can be used to detect errors in real-world Javascript code.

Areas of application will be defined together with the student, considering the student's interests. For example, a suggestion is to write a prototype that detects malicious activities such as Crypto Mining or Drive-by Download attacks. Other classes of problems can be considered.
requirements:
Interested students should:
1. Enjoy programming and learning about new programming languages and technologies
2. Be interested in software engineering and software reliability
3. Be willing to learn new concepts and tools, and to apply them in real-world scenarios

title: [Dissertation] TimeWarp Studying animated transitions between time compressed visualizations
observations:
As técnicas tradicionais para visualização de informação lidam com conjuntos de dados conhecidos à partida e de pequenas dimensões (mesmo milhares de items é pouco, neste contexto). Se quisermos visualizar Big Data precisamos de algo novo. Temos já uma abordagem que permite ir agregando os dados progressivamente. Cada visualização representa um intervalo de tempo. À direita é real-time, imediatamente a seguir podemos estar a olhar para um agregado dos últimos minutos, em seguida das últimas horas, etc. Mas importa que não se perca o contexto, que se perceba para onde vão os valores…

Sem que se perca o contexto da análise, quais as transições entre os idiomas visuais que funcionam melhor entre diferentee escalas de compressão? Passar de segundos para minutos é diferente de passer de segundos diretamente para horas. Que técnicas funcionam melhor em que contexto? Deverão ser concebidas as transições, implementadas e (foco principal) feitos os user studies que respondam a estas perguntas! Já existe um sistema que suporta transições, aqui só as temos que criar e estudar.
objectives: Estudar a resiliência e compreensibilidade de transições animadas entre visualizações representado dados com diferentes níveis de agregação temporal.

title: Dissertação: PriVeil performance, scalability and integration improvements
objectives:
Existing solutions allow cybersecurity threat information sharing using anonymization filters to prevent leakage of sensitive information. However, relevant details can be lost during the process, and prevent the information from being useful. Participants must be willing to provide their sensible, but unaltered, information to the platform and likewise be able to gather trustworthy information published by other participants. Studies have shown that companies would be more willing to participate if they were assured to have full control over the shared data, without disclosure of private knowledge, and were able to trust information received from other participants.

The PriVeil (privacy veil) work is a prototype of a threat information sharing system design that is able to match participants with identical security vulnerabilities, encouraging cooperation to identify these issues while retaining full control over their private data. Privacy-preserving techniques like Homomorphic Encryption and Secure Multi-party Computation are used to assure that no sensible information is unwillingly disclosed by the system.

The current prototype can be improved to achieve better response time performance, better scalability for operation with a larger number of participants, and better integration with existing security tools such as MISP and OpenVAS that allow it to be used in actual deployments.

References:

C. S. Johnson, M. L. Badger, D. A. Waltermire, J. Snyder, and C. Skorupka, \Guide to
cyber threat information sharing," NIST, Report 800-150, Oct. 2016. [Online]. Available:
https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-150.pdf

C. Sauerwein, C. Sillaber, A. Mussmann, and R. Breu, \Threat intelligence sharing platforms:
An exploratory study of software vendors and research perspectives," in Wirtschaftsinformatik,
2017.

M. M. Potey, C. Dhote, and D. Sharma, \Homomorphic encryption for security of cloud data,"
Procedia Computer Science, vol. 79, pp. 175{181, 12 2016.

X. Wang, S. Ranellucci, and J. Katz, \Global-scale secure multiparty computation," in
Proceedings of the 2017 ACM SIGSAC Conference on Computer and Communications
Security, ser. CCS ’17. New York, NY, USA: ACM, 2017, pp. 39{56. [Online]. Available:
https://eprint.iacr.org/2017/189.pdf
requirements:
Realização do projeto em tempo integral, 40 horas/semana (excepto cadeiras do curso).SIRS > 15
Crypto enthusiast

title: Dissertação: qDocs/EnsinoSuperior – Agilizar os processos burocráticos dos Alunos do Ensino Superior, através de uma Plataforma de Automação de Documentos centrada no Cidadão
observations: Proposta pré-atribuída ao aluno: Leonardo Pereira Troeira (94104)
objectives:
O qDocs é uma plataforma de automação de documentos, centrada no Cidadão, multi-Curador, geridos de forma distribuída, dinâmica e segura, e acessíveis a partir de qualquer tipo de equipamento tecnológico (e.g., smartphones, tablets, computadores). 
Por um lado, o qDocs permite a definição e utilização de templates de documentos electrónicos (e.g., documentos de identificação, certificados, relatórios, formulários, questionários) com base na orquestração de serviços e de dados mantidos por diferentes Curadores (i.e., entidades públicas e privadas), e geridos de forma distribuída, dinâmica e segura. Por outro lado, o qDocs é uma plataforma colaborativa que promove e facilita a relação entre o Cidadão e os Curadores em todos os processos que envolvam a solicitação, publicação, acesso, apresentação ou partilha de documentos electrónicos. (Consultar https://qdocs.eu/ para mais informações.)

No âmbito deste projeto pretende-se investigar a aplicação da tecnologia e paradigma qDocs ao dominío das Escolas do Ensino Superior (EES, i.e., Universidades, Politécnicos, Faculdades, Institutos), em particular considerando como principal ator do negócio o aluno (o docente e funcionário poderão ser considerados mais tarde se relevante); e (ii) os principais processos e documentos administrativos relacionados com a identificação dos atores (e.g., cartão de estudante), pedidos de certidões e certidões (e.g., carta de curso), requerimentos, formulários, declarações, etc.
Para tal, este projeto deverá desenvolver-se ao longo de três fases:
A primeira fase consiste na análise e definição do problema através de uma arquitectura do sistema de informação e suportada pelas seguintes perspectivas (vistas): definição de stakeholders, processos de negócio, aplicações e bases de dados, e documentos eletrónicos e/ou físicos envolvidos. 
A segunda fase consiste no desenho e prototipagem da solução “qBox/EnsinoSuperior”, pela definição dos tipos de documentos identificados, e pela definição e estabelecimento dos conectores às bases de dados existentes no domíno das EES. Deverá também ser desenvolvido mecanismo de notificações e mensagens integrado no sistema qDocs, e aspetos de usabilidade da applicação qDocs/Citizen.
A terceira fase consiste na disponibilização da solução “qBox/EnsinoSuperior” num contexto controlado (e.g., no âmbito do IST), na sua divulgação aos alunos da escola, a avaliação e discussão dos resultados.

title: Dissertação: Tutor for learning based on multiple choice questions
observations: Caso o aluno demonstre capacidade de desenvolver trabalho relevante, poderá haver uma bolsa de licenciatura durante parte do período do mestrado.
objectives:
The Software Architecture course has been extensively using multiple choice questions, both for exams and mini-tests. Currently there are about 600 questions that are being stored in a repository and enriched with meta information about its subject, difficulty, etc. A system was designed and implemented that allows students to answer questions and is available 24x7.

In this thesis we intend to extend the system to implement a tutor that can be used by the students as a learning tool. The tutor should be able to hold a model of each student current level of knowledge and guide their learning process.
requirements:
- Study the existing tutor systems for learning- Define a student learning process model for the Software Architecture course
- Implement the system and evaluate the learning process.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projecto: Ocupação de Espaços Públicos
objectives:
Conhecer a ocupação de um espaço público (paragem de transportes, atendimento público, sala de estudo) é uma utilidade para os cidadãos planearem os momentos mais convenientes para se deslocarem ao local ou serviço e o utilizarem de forma mais eficiente e confortável. No entanto não existe uma única medida capaz de a quantificar. A instalação de sistemas vídeo com acesso remoto (tipo webcam), embora tecnicamente possível tem fortes restrições legais. 
Neste projecto pretende-se avaliar a utilização de diversos tipos de sensores que, de alguma forma, sejam indicadores de actividade e de concentração de pessoas – qualidade do ar (ex. CO2), luminosidade, ruído, vibração – para inferir de forma não intrusiva a ocupação de um espaço e fornecer esta informação de forma simplificada, intuitiva, mas confiável, a utilizadores on-line através de uma infraestrutura IoT.
requirements: Interesse por sistemas IoT.

title: (Dissertação) This one time, at band camp... - Geração de diálogos para partilha de episódios emocionais
observations:
Trabalho proposto pela aluna nº 83427, Ana Antunes.
Unidades curriculares recomendadas: Agentes Autónomos e Sistemas Multi-Agente. Robôs Sociais e Interacção Humano-Robô. Língua Natural.
objectives:
Partilha de emoções (ou “Emotion Sharing” no termo anglo-saxónico) ocorre quando uma pessoa partilha com outra um episódio emocional (onde tenha acontecido algo que gerou emoções fortes) passado. Vários estudos mostram que pessoas que partilhem com mais frequência episódios emocionais têm uma maior facilidade em fazer com que as outras pessoas gostem delas. Portanto, para conseguir criar agentes socialmente inteligentes capazes de estabelecer relações sociais de longo termo com utilizadores é importante olhar para esta capacidade de partilhar episódios emocionais. 

Esta tese tem como objectivo a geração de diálogo em língua natural para a partilha de episódios emocionais na Arquitectura de Agentes FAtiMA.  Explorando técnicas de aprendizagem, pretende-se abordar este problema como um problema de tradução entre eventos (representados por tuplos) e Língua Natural.

Em termos de organização, o trabalho visa as seguintes etapas: a) Levantamento do estado da arte em partilha de emoções, geração de diálogo em narrativas e Língua Natural. b) geração de sumários (conjuntos de eventos) na arquitectura FAtiMA; c) criação de um corpus anotado com exemplos de tradução de eventos para língua natural; d) treino de um modelo usando várias técnicas de aprendizagem; e) análise dos resultados; f) integração do modelo na arquitectura FAtiMA; g) Escrita da tese.

title: Dissertation: Scalable consistency service
observations: Tema atribuído a João Gonçalves, 83489
objectives:
To cope with an ever increasing demand, modern systems need to work at an unprecedented scale.
This lead to the emergence of the NoSQL movement with approaches that can indeed scale but at the cost of relaxed consistency guarantees.
The relaxed guarantees are due, in part, from the difficulty in having good knowledge of the processes that belong to the system, in particular in dynamic environments subject to faults and partitions.
The goal off this thesis proposal is to explore how consistent hashing techniques and an existing scalable membership service can be combined to provide stronger consistency guarantees to large-scale distributed applications.

Bibliography:

[1] EpTO: An epidemic total order algorithm for large-scale distributed systems. M. Matos, et al. In Proceedings of the 16th Annual Middleware Conference (Middleware), 2015.
[2] Stable and Consistent Membership at Scale with Rapid. L. Suresh, et al. ATC  2019.
[3] SWIM: Scalable Weakly-consistentInfection-style process group Membership protocol. A. Das, et al. In Proceedings of the 2002 International Conference on Dependable Systems and Networks, 2002.
[4] D. Karger, et al. Consistent hashing and random trees: distributed caching protocols for relieving hot spots on the World Wide Web. In Proceedings of the twenty-ninth annual ACM symposium on Theory of computing (STOC '97).
[5] Norbert cluster management.  https://github.com/rhavyn/
requirements:
The student should be familiar with advanced distributed systems concepts.Frequency of DAD and SEC is a plus.
Good programming skills.
The thesis should be done as full time (excluding, naturally, other course duties).

supervisors: Teresa Maria Sá Ferreira Vazão Vasques (50%)
specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: PROJECTO: SmartMob-AR: Plataforma de realidade aumentada para desenvolvimento e validação de sistemas de mobilidade inteligente
observations:
Possibilidade de atribuição de bolsa durante o semestre de tese.

Teresa Vazão: teresa.vazao@tecnico.ulisboa.pt
Alfredo Ferreira: alfredo.ferreira@tecnico.ulisboa.pt
objectives:
O sistema SmartMob@Tecnico consiste numa plataforma de suporte ao desenvolvimento e validação de projetos de índole tecnológica com aplicação dos conceitos de Internet das Coisas ao domínio das cidades inteligentes, com especial ênfase para a mobilidade sustentável.
O sistema atual contempla uma plataforma experimental, que representa o mundo físico miniaturizado e que permite testar e validar as soluções desenvolvidas, num ambiente controlado, dando resposta à pesquisa e experimentação de soluções que permitam dar resposta aos problemas causados pelo mundo físico

Pretende-se com esta tese desenvolver uma plataforma virtual, que mimifica o mundo físico num ambiente de simulação virtual. Este permite testar e validar as soluções desenvolvidas, dando resposta às questões de escala que não são possíveis endereçar no mundo físico. 
Neste ambiente virtual simulado os elementos do mundo miniaturizado são representados virtualmente e interagem com outros elementos que não possuem representação física. 

A interação efetua-se através da integração dos elementos do mundo real num simulador de redes, como o VEINs ou o NS-3. Em termos de visualização, serão utilizadas as plataformas Unity3D e VuForia para desenvolver um sistema de realidade aumentado que permita visualizar no mundo miniaturizado todo um conjunto de elementos que apenas existem no ambiente virtual simulado. Este sistema deverá funcionar em dois dispositivos: um dispositivo móvel (tablet) e um conjunto de óculos de realidade aumentada (META 2).

title: Dissertation: Mood-based Procedural Content Placement for Games
objectives:
Procedural Content Generation (PCG), i.e. how game content can be created algorithmically, is an increasingly important area and currently one of the most active topics within the software games industry and game research. When generating content for a certain level, being able to insure that all gameplay elements placed together, from the audio-visual elements to the mechanics themselves, strengthen the desired mood for that level is of great importance for the player experience. This work will explore how the inferred mood of a player and the desired mood for a level could modulate the procedural content generation process to create a more interesting experience for the player.

Main sub-goals:
( 1 ) Literature review (semester 1)
( 2 ) Computational model (semester 1 and 2)
( 3 ) Test scenario implementation (semester 2)
( 4 ) User studies (semester 2)
requirements: This thesis proposal is open to all MSc students from the Master Degree in Information Systems and Computer Engineering of Instituto Superior Técnico.

title: Dissertação - Workflow Management for networked organizations with Blockchain technology
objectives:
To design, implement and test a software prototype for workflow management of networked organizations using blockchain technology.
 
Problem to be addressed: To connect and make more efficient the inter-work of different organizations (or stakeholders from different organizations) participating in a workflow crossing different organizations, and various internal workflow management systems.
 
 
Main steps:
-       Literature review
-       Identify scenarios and requirements for a blockchain solution to support the workflow management in networked organizations
-       Design a system architecture
-       Implement a prototype using the blockchain technology that supports inter-organizational workflow management
-       Perform tests and write conclusions, e.g., explain improvements – for example reduction of costs, reduction of time - in executing specific scenarios.
 
Focusing on a specific sector for example the financial sector, or some educational institutions, where the operations are mainly paper-based, and the use of such a prototype determines significant improvements (e.g., decrease of the time to execute processes, decrease of costs, less errors).
 
In the financial sector, for example, the focus could be on the credit business process (e.g., starting with the application submitted by a client, internal verifications and approvals – as sub-processes, and verifications that require the exchange of information with other financial institutions – to check for example if the client has another credit to a different bank).
Or the educational institutions – then the business process for the accreditation of a diploma can be the main focus.

Below are some references.
1) Sturm C., Szalanczi J., Schönig S., Jablonski S. (2019) A Lean Architecture for Blockchain Based Decentralized Process Execution. In: Daniel F., Sheng Q., Motahari H. (eds) Business Process Management Workshops. BPM 2018. Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing, vol 342. Springer, Cham

2) Ming Li, Leidi Shen, George Q. Huang. (2019) Blockchain-enabled workflow operating system for logistics resources sharing in e-commerce logistics real estate service. Computers & Industrial Engineering  135: 950-969.

3) Joerg Evermann, Henry Kim, Workflow Management on the Blockchain - Implications and Recommendations. Arvix, Available at: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1904.01004.pdf

title: Project: Dashboard for Biodiversity Monitoring from IoT Sensor Networks
location: The work will be conducted at the Interactive Technologies Institute of LARSYS (http://iti.larsys.pt) in close collaboration with the research group.
observations: This project is part of a European funded research project and students might have access to research internships during the summer.
objectives: In a nutshell, people and wildlife are at serious risks, unless urgent action is taken to mitigate and hopefully reverse the loss of plants and animals on which our ecosystems depend on food, clean water, and a stable climate. In response to these challenges, several ICT research groups are looking at using IoT and sensor networks to monitor ecosystems. These sensors span from simple DIY weather stations to more complex devices capable of detecting animals and changes in biodiversity with camera traps and microphones which can process meaningful events using machine learning and data mining algorithms. However, showing this information to citizens in a way that enables them to contribute and act upon the collected data requires new analytics. This project will develop an open-source analytics platform that could bring existing sensor data to citizens.
requirements: Students should be familiar with standard web development tools and platforms, in particular, Javascript/Node.JS and HTML5, CSS3 and D3, to implement analytics dashboards and advanced visualizations. Students should be interested in Interaction and Design and Human-Computer Interaction techniques since the development of the prototype will require conducting participatory design and evaluation sessions with end-users.
