Excelente projecto para quem goste de música e de tecnologia "semantic web".O problema da wikidata é muito semelhante ao colocado neste projecto. Por isso, uma hipótese de solução poderá ser tirar partido da infraestrutura já oferecida pela wikidata e respectivas tools (https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Wikidata:Tools)
Por exemplo, considera-se este caso como inspirador para um possível resultado para esta tese (algo replicando ou mesmo contribuindo para a wikidata com os dados em causa seria interessante):
https://tools.wmflabs.org/reasonator/?q=Q1339
https://tools.wmflabs.org/reasonator/?q=Q1339&lang=pt

supervisors: Pedro Manuel Moreira Vaz Antunes de Sousa (100%)
specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projeto: Captura de Eventos patra a Cartografia Empresarial
location: Instalações da Link Consulting, Av Duque de Ávila 23, 1000-138 Lisboa
objectives:
O objetivo desta dissertação é desenvolver  sondas de captação de eventos oranizacionais que permitam automatizar geração de 
vistas representativas da arquitetura das organizações através da solução Atlas (atlas.linkconsulting.com)

As sondas devem permitir uma abordagem incremental, classificando a informação recolhida de forma a ir-se completando a arquitetura da organização, à medida que se vai recolhendo a informação..

As  fontes de informação a considerar são heterógeneas, podendo ir desde documentos Office, modelos de formais (ex: archimate, UML), ou sistemas estruturados (bases de dados).  Uma das principais fontes de informação a incluir na a recolha da informação  são os projetos de desenvolvimento, nomeadamente os seus planos e os modelos dos artefacts a produzir no projeto. 

Tipicamente, as ferramentas de arquitetura empresarial disponibilizam interfaces para a modelação gráfica  que, por serem manuais, implicam um elevado esforço de manutenção desses modelos. Na prática isto significa que as organizações não têm modelos atualizados que descrevam a sua realidade, pois os modelos existentes estão desatualizados.

O termo cartografia empresarial é usado em vez do termo arquitetura empresarial, para salientar o processo de recolha e  geração automática dos modelos em vez da edição manual como é o caso das ferramentas de modelação. Apesar de existirem domínios onde este processo esteja já consolidado, como por exemplo para o dominio do processos de negócio (process mining) , para o dominio dos modelos de dados (data reverse engeneering) e mesmo para as infraestruturas, existe ainda muitas lacunas no que diz respeito á cartografia da arquitetura empresarial como um todo.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Optimização de Treino de Redes Neuronais
observations: Co-orientação externa: Nuno Lopes (nlopes@microsoft.com), Microsoft Research Cambridge
objectives:
O treino de redes neuronais ou de outros modelos de machine learning em uso é uma tarefa computacionalmente pesada. Modelos mais complexos demoram várias semanas a convergir.
O aparecimento de aceleradores especializados (e.g., Google TPU) reduziu significativamente o tempo de treino. No entanto, estes chips têm ainda uma utilização aquém do throughput máximo.
Este trabalho incide na optimização de algoritmos distribuídos e/ou paralelos para treino de redes neuronais e outras (DNNs, CNNs, RL, etc) em aceleradores especializados, tendo como objectivo melhorar a performance e reduzir o consumo energético. O tipo de algoritmos inclui, por exemplo, multiplicação de matrizes, convolução, compressão, ajuste automático de precisão das operações, escalonamento de tarefas e alocação de memória em sistemas NUMA.

title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Automatic Repair of LaTex documents
observations: Delta debugging is perhaps the most appropriate fault localisation technique. This would be a good starting point.
objectives:
TeX and LaTeX: TeX is a typesetting computer program created by Donald Knuth, originally for his magnum opus, The Art of Computer Programming. It takes a "plain" text file and converts it into a high-quality document for printing or on-screen viewing. LaTeX is a macro system built on top of TeX that aims to simplify its use and automate many common formatting tasks. It is the de-facto standard for academic journals and books, and provides some of the best typography free software has to offer.

An issue with LaTex is that when it fails, it is very difficult to find the root cause of the observed problem. The idea of this thesis is to develop a toolset to aid in debugging LaTeX issues. We will start by a systematic survey of fault localisation and automatic repair techniques and then we will implement it in a toolset that will be made publicly available. The tool is expected to have a considerable impact and we will seek it to be accepted as part of the GNU toolchain (or any other appropriate open source foundation).
requirements:
Interested students should:
1. Enjoy programming and learning about new programming languages and technologies
2. Be interested in software engineering and software reliability
3. Be willing to learn new concepts and tools, and to apply them in real-world scenarios

title: Dissertação: Stochastic Multi-Objective Combinatorial Optimization Algorithms
observations: Miguel Neves, miguel.neves@outsystems.com
objectives:
Multi-Objective Combinatorial Optimization (MOCO) has several real-world applications such as Virtual Machine Consolidation, Configuration
of Software Product Lines, among other. Recently, new approaches for MOCO have been proposed based on iteratively solving Propositional Logic formulations. 
Moreover, this approach has been shown to effectively solve more constrained problem instances. On the other hand, stochastic approaches are usually
better on less constrained instances. 
In this work, the goal is to develop a generic stochastic approach for solving MOCO problem instances formulated as Multi-Objective
Boolean formulas. Moreover, the stochastic algorithm should incorporate Logic-based techniques that would allow a faster convergence of the
stochastic algorithm.

title: Dissertação: Resilient File survivability in Peer-to-Peer Networks based on Stochastic Swarm Guidance
objectives: A corrente proposta de tese de mestrado visa analisar formalmente os mecanismos de survivability em redes P2P baseados em stochastic swarm guidance. Esse é um conceito utilizado para criar formações dinâmicas de robots mas que tem um grande paralelismo com as partes de ficheiros em redes P2P. Do ponto de vista da área do controlo, este tipo de abordagem tem uma formulação teórica interessante que permite dar resultados e garantias em termos da probabilidade de perda dos ficheiros. Pretende-se também averiguar fairness dos algoritmos de forma a que não seja possível um conjunto de atacantes receber todas as partes críticas de um ficheiro na rede bem como garantir privacidade diferencial de forma a evitar que os detentores dos ficheiros tenham de expor a informação de que são os proprietários desses mesmos ficheiros.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Big data processing performance benchmarking
location: Distributed Systems Group, INESC-ID, Instituto Superior Técnico, Universidade de Lisboa.
observations: Unicage cluster tools and required licenses, along with technical support, will be provided to the student.
objectives:
Data is being produced in large volumes and in multiple varieties. This trend is intensifying and companies need to process more data, more efficiently, if they are to consider relevant data in business decisions. A specific example of activities made possible by big data processing are timely reports, but also more sophisticated outputs such as Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence.

Two widely used data processing systems are Apache Hadoop and Apache Hive. Both rely on complex software stacks and provide higher-level abstractions that allow clusters of machines to be used as if they were a single, large machine. However, the cost of these abstractions is significant, when compared with a leaner system such as Unicage, as shown in previous work  [Moreira18].

The goal of this work is to go beyond single machine performance comparison of Unicage with Hadoop and Hive, and to perform experiments with clusters of machines, capable of handling larger datasets. The cost (and benefit) of distributed system abstractions will also be assessed, with a clear definition of conceptual models for the data flow [Batini92] and the re-use of existing benchmarks, such as LeanBench [Moreira18] or BigDataBench [Wang14] for the performance experiments.

João M. P. Moreira, Helena Galhardas, Miguel L. Pardal, “LeanBench: comparing software stacks for batch and query processing of IoT data”, 9th International Conference on Ambient Systems, Networks and Technologies (ANT), 2018.


L. Wang, J. Zhan, C. Luo, Y. Zhu, Q. Yang, Y. He, W. Gao, Z. Jia, Y. Shi, S. Zhang, et al. Bigdatabench: A big data benchmark suite from internet services. In 2014 IEEE 20th International
Symposium on High Performance Computer Architecture (HPCA), pages 488–499. IEEE, 2014.
http://www.benchcouncil.org/BigDataBench/index.html

Carlo Batini, Stefano Ceri, Shamkant B. Navathe. “Conceptual database design: an Entity-relationship approach”. Vol. 116. Redwood City, CA: Benjamin/Cummings, 1992.

Tools:
https://hadoop.apache.org/
https://hive.apache.org/
https://unicage.com/
requirements:
Full-time (40 hour a week) commitment to academic activities (i.e. no part-time jobs).Database course grade >14
Cloud Computing and Virtualization course grade >14
Motivation to perform experimental work and optimize data processing performance.

title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Deep Learning for Time Series Forecasting
Dissertação: Mono2Micro - From a Monolith to Microservices: The dynamic analysis of application in the JVM
objectives:
The microservices architecture allows the existence of several autonomous agile development teams but result in a distributed system where the aspect of consistency becomes critical, the CAP theorem.

As results of previous MSc thesis, a tool was developed for monolith applications, developed using Spring-Boot and Fénix-Framework, that applies static code analysis to collect which domain entities are accessed by each one of the application's controllers, uses similarity measures to define clusters, and provides a user interface to allow the software developer analyse different partitioning hypothesis.

The goal of this thesis is to extend the existing Mono2Micro to dynamically analyse the execution of monolith applications running on top of the JVM, define a new set of metrics on the collect data, apply clustering algorithms, and compare with the results obtained using code static analysis.
requirements: The use of dynamic analysis tools (Java Agent) to collect data about the functioning of the monolith, while reducing the runtime impact of the code inspections.

title: Dissertação: Hacking the systems from within
location: INESC-ID, Alameda Campus (Rua Alves Redol, 9 - 1000-029 Lisboa)
objectives:
To foster security, modern processors deploy a set of features and security-related instructions to define private regions of memory (enclaves), whose contents are protected and unable to be either read or written by any process outside the enclave itself. For example, Intel SGX involves encryption by the CPU of a portion of memory, whose content is decrypted on the fly only within the CPU itself. The processor thus protects the code from being "spied on" or examined by other code.

However, these features can also provide a valuable source of information to attackers, allowing them in some cases to hack the system or discover private data, like secret keys. The latest examples of these are the Spectre and Foreshadow vulnerabilities (https://meltdownattack.com/).

The goal of this work is to explore the possible vulnerabilities that may be derived from the internal processor registers, towards the identification of new classes of attacks.

title: Dissertação: Extension and deployment of an i-voting system
observations:
This task is part of an ongoing project that involves other master students, with whom the student is expected to collaborate.

More information: http://web.ist.utl.pt/~ist24690/thesisproposals/ 

Jan Cederquist - jan.cederquist@tecnico.ulisboa.pt
Ana Matos - ana.matos@tecnico.ulisboa.pt
objectives:
Research in cryptography has provided a range of tools for implementing electronic voting systems, that enable people to vote remotely - through the Internet, while providing the required security guarantees such as anonymous communication, public verifiability and everlasting privacy. Different voting contexts have different security requirements, and suitable voting protocols place trust on different elements of a system. Invariably, in practice, protocol security relies on that certain software components are correctly implemented, and are free from coding errors that introduce undesirable behavior in the form of security vulnerabilities. Such vulnerabilities can ultimately be exploited by attackers in order to hack an election.

The aim of this thesis is to extend and deploy an existing implementation of an i-voting (internet voting) system that is based on the H-Belenios protocol. This will include incorporating additional relevant security features in the H-Belenios procol (receipt freeness, threshold for key-sharing), presenting the system to the academic community, and organising an election that uses it.

Expected Result: This will be an important phase of a larger project, which consists of the development of a secure and robust i-voting system to be presented to the academic community with the purpose of integrating it in Fenix.
requirements: Successful attendance of a masters-level course in security, verification or quality of software.

title: Dissertation: Harnessing the power of modern multi-core and GPU systems with tasks with data dependencies
observations: Possibility of a research grant
objectives:
The full power of modern multi-core systems and accelerators (e.g. GPUs)  can only be exploited by applications expose high levels of parallelism. The paradigm of tasks with dependencies is seen as one of the most promising ways of achieving unprecedented parallelism levels in irregular HPC applications. Still, that promise is yet to be validated.

This thesis aims at evaluating the potential of the task with dependencies programming model when applied to the Particle-In-Cell (PIC) method, a well
studied means of investigating the behaviour of different kinds of systems involving electrons, ions, neutrals, molecules, dust particles, etc.

Departing from a lower-level solution of PIC, the thesis will design and implement a variant code that relies on tasks with dependencies.
An experimental evaluation will shed new light on the actual gains (and costs) of this paradigm.
requirements: The student should be familiar with parallel programming and computer architectures.

location: Spoken Language Systems Lab, INESC-ID Lisboa
observations: Toda a produção será realizada em inglês.
objectives: Development of generative models for textual image descriptions.

title: (Dissertação) DevOps Maturity Model: From strategy to results
observations:
Para mais informações vide: https://sites.google.com/site/vasconcelosandre/teses/mestrado/temas-mestrado
Proposto  por Aluno: Yasser Zacarias Nº Aluno: 88647
objectives:
Motivação: 

A introdução do DevOps no paradigma de funcionamento das equipas de desenvolvimento e suporte de software e sistemas coloca desafios e mudanças que ainda não são devidamente conhecidos em contextos profissionais, destancando-se:
•	Superar a mentalidade “Dev” versus “Ops”
•	Mudar de infraestrutura “legacy” para os microsserviços
•	Muito foco nas ferramentas
•	Resistência à Mudança
•	Ferramentas de Dev e Operação têm métricas e stacks substancialmente distintos.

Pretende-se, com esta tese, e através da implementação das práticas, ferramentas e metodologias em contexto real, ter uma referência credível dos impactos da respetiva implementação, das dificuldades sentidas na sua adoção, bem como definir pistas para mitigação das referidas dificuldades.

Descrição:
Nesta dissertação, numa primeira fase, pretende-se proceder ao levantamento do estado da arte em termos de Práticas de Desenvolvimento, Operação e Governança dos Sistemas de Informação, incluindo as frameworks de referência existentes (e.g., COBIT, ITIL, …) e outras normas relevantes (TOGAF, RGPD, ISO27002, etc).
Em seguida deverá propor extensão de modelo de maturidade para aferição do alinhamento de uma organização com os princípios de DevOps.

A partir de uma realidade concreta numa equipa real, em contexto profissional, o modelo proposto aplicado para:
•	Avaliar a maturidade da equipa para a migração para DevOps (ferramentas, processos, conhecimento, etc.)
•	Definir o roadmap adequado para a realidade observada
•	Definir a estratégia de adoção e resultados esperados

O aluno será integrado em projeto piloto para adoção de DevOps incluindo o registo de dificuldades, medição de avanços e melhorias observadas/medidas de acordo com os KPI’s previamente definidos.
requirements:
Resultados Esperados:1. Levantamento de Estado da arte de DevOps e Governação de Sistemas de Informação
2. Proposta de modelo de maturidade para aferição do alinhamento de uma organização com os princípios de DevOps.
3. Implementação de Projeto piloto
4. Publicação de artigo.

title: [DISSERTAÇÃO] Ad hoc teamwork using deep multi-agent reinforcement learning
observations:
In this work, the student will investigate multi-agent deep reinforcement learning (RL) in the context of ad hoc teamwork. Ad hoc teamwork investigates the problem of an agent that must coordinate with a team of unknown teammates in a possibly unknown task [4]. While several approaches have been used for ad hoc teamwork - not all of which relying on RL [3] - state-of-the-art algorithms address the ad hoc teamwork problem as a single-agent RL problem [1]. 

However, despite the fact that ad hoc teamwork necessarily features multi-agent domains, existing RL-based approaches implicitly assume the teammates to follow a stationary policy, treating teammates as part of the environment [1]. Therefore, such approaches are expected to perform poorly in the presence of non-stationary teammates - for example, teammates that learn.

In order to address this problem, the student will combine two key ideas: a centralized-critic-decentralized-actor (CC-DA) architecture with a bounded-memory teammate model. The CC-DA architecture has been featured in several state-of-the-art multiagent RL approaches [5]; bounded-memory teammate models, on the other hand, have been exploited in recent works on ad hoc teamwork [2, 3]. 

References:

[1] S. Barrett, A. Rosenfeld, S. Kraus, P. Stone. Making friends on the fly: Cooperating with new teammates. Artificial Intelligence, 242:132-171, 2017.

[2] D. Chakraborty, P. Stone. Cooperating with a Markovian ad hoc teammate. In Proc. 12th Int. Conf. Autonomous Agents and Multiagent Systems, pp. 1085-1092, 2013.

[3] F. Melo, A. Sardinha. Ad hoc teamwork by learning teammates' task. J. Autonomous Agents and Multi-agent Systems, 30(2):175-219, 2016.

[4] P. Stone, G. Kaminka, S. Kraus, J. Rosenschein. Ad hoc autonomous agent teams: Collaboration without pre-coordination. In Proc. 24th AAAI Conf. Artificial Intelligence, pp.  1504-1509, 2010.

[5] T. Rashid, M. Samvelyan, C. Schroeder, G. Farquhar, J. Foerster, S. Whiteson. QMIX: Monotonic value function factorisation for deep multi-agent reinforcement learning. In Proc. 35th Int. Conf. Machine Learning, pp. 4295-4304, 2018.
requirements: The student should be comfortable with reinforcement learning and multi-agent systems, as provided in courses such as PADI and AASMA.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Criação de uma framework para implementação da norma ISO9001

title: [Dissertação] Building more decentralized blockchains using secure virtual coordinates
observations: Aluno: Marco F Silva
objectives:
One of the core components of the design of a Blockchain-related system is an overlay that is used for aspects such as deciding who needs to perform certain tasks or for disseminating the results of transactions. In this thesis we will explore how the topology that is formed when building this overlay can be leveraged to make the system perform better or become more secure.

The former aspect (performance) can be improved by taking into account the location of the nodes when, e.g., running consensus. In this case we would like to be able to avoid the protocol steps that require cross-node communication in the critical path having to cross high latency links. The latter aspect (security) would tackle the problem of the lack of diversity that is currently observed in overlays such as bitcoin or ethereum, where a large fraction of the nodes are concentrated in a handful of data centers. To enforce more diversity, the idea is to use a secure virtual coordinate system to always execute consensus that are not in the same physical location. The insight for securing the virtual coordinate system is the fact that speed of light delays imply that a malicious node cannot pretend to be closer to a certain location than it actually is.

title: Dissertação || DocA: medical Doctor Agenda optimizer
observations: Further details see  https://sites.google.com/site/vasconcelosandre/teses/mestrado/temas-mestrado
objectives:
Enquadramento: 
As growing costs pressure health systems, mainly due to an ageing population, the rise of the private medical service providers has been growing in Portugal. In 2013, nearly half of Portugal’s hospitals were private. Over the last ten years, private hospitals have grown in consultations, number of beds, emergency rooms and diagnostic tests. The number of outpatient medical consultations increased steadily between 2002 and 2013, from 9,8 million to 17,6 million visits, with private hospitals accounting for 5,1 million consultations, 29% of the total. 
The growth of private health insurance, reduced waiting times and advanced technology, are among the main growth drivers for private medical service providers.
Although major private medical service providers in Portugal have an electronic reservation system, the process of booking a medical consultation is generally a tedious process and always limited to the service provider’s ecosystem. 
MedClick provides a one-stop platform to book a medical appointment in a fast and user friendly way, across multiple medical service providers. Whether on a PC, tablet or smartphone, patients conveniently browse all available booking options, based on date, location, price, insurance providers, or customer reviews and recommendations. 
MedClick helps medical service providers increase the efficiency of their practices, by featuring an advanced platform to manage and explore scheduling flexibility, filling available time slots. Additionally, with MedClick’s advanced user registration screening process and automated email and SMS reminders, the number of missed appointments will also be significantly reduced. 
…………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………………
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       Descrição:
MedClick is an online platform is available online through a web portal and mobile apps for Android and iOS smartphones. The major functionalities are described bellow: 

 
The platform allows the access of several types of users: the patients, the doctors, the administrator, the contact center staff, the sales team personnel, and the insurance company
 
Patients are able to access the portal and immediately search for a doctor and book a medical appointment. 
The major focus of this thesis is a new differentiation functionality of MedClick: the optimization of the medical doctor agenda, considering the patients profile the expected healthcare required, in order to ensure the minimum waiting time for patients and that the medical doctor has always patients (even when noshows occur).
Therefore from a set of existing data, including patient gender, marriage status, age, distance to medical center, patient no show record, MedClick is expected to estimate each patient probability of “noshow”. On the “other side”, each medical doctor past consultation times is considered. Therefore when scheduling a new patient several scheduling strategies may be suggested – e.g., overbooking, schedule specific patients to the end of the day, extra reminders to specific patients, management of last minute no shows (including provide Clinics tools for fulfilling “last-minute” vacancy slots, namely by notifying patients that have less time constraints in exchange for higher discounts).
requirements:
Resultados Esperados: 1. MedClick Doctor Agenda optimizer specification
2. Agenda optimizer prototype implementation
3. Paper Publication.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: GameCourse: the adaptation of teaching strategies according to student profiles
objectives:
A gamificação e a descoberta de informação em dados educacionais são duas disciplinas emergentes, e a combinação das duas prometem resultados importantes para a evolução dos sistemas de ensino assistidos.
O presente trabalho tem por objetivo aplicar as técnicas de descoberta de informação a dados recolhidos em disciplinas já gamificadas. Estes dados portanto apresentam-se como sequências temporais de elementos de avaliação de cada aluno. Entre os diferentes elementos encontram-se logs de utilização do sistema de suporte à gamificação, as atividades concluídas por cada aluno, as recompensas obtidas, os posts efetuado, enfim, todas as interações dos alunos com o sistema.
Em concreto, o trabalho a desenvolver passa criar/adaptar algoritmos capazes de analisar os perfis de estudantes anteriormente identificados, de modo a conceber modelos capazes de determinar as estratégias de ensino que maximizem o desempenho de cada perfil de alunos.
requirements: Aprovação já obtida na disciplina de Ciência de Dados ou equivalente.

title: Projecto: Micropagamentos na IoT
location: Link Consulting, Av. Duque de Ávila, Lisboa (junto ao campus da Alameda)
observations: Orientador externo: Joel Teixeira, Link Consulting, joel.teixeira@linkconsulting.com
objectives:
Micropagamentos no contexto da IoT usando cryptocurrencies
 
Problema:
 
A generalização das moedas digitais (cryptocurrencies) veio demonstrar a possibilidade de implementação de transações seguras com validação distribuída baseadas na implementação  “block chain”. Esta tecnologia tem custos de processamento consideráveis suportáveis para a realização de transações financeiras de valor elevado, mas não é adequada para suportar transações numerosas, e de baixo valor.
 
Novas variantes dos algoritmos usados inicialmente têm sido propostas para permitir a implementar micropagamentos nas transações M2M associadas ao IOT, como é o caso do IOTA uma moeda digital adequada a suportar o registo seguro de transações associados ao IoT que evita o peso associado à implementação “block chain” mantendo o armazenamento seguro de dados e a validação distribuída das transações.
 
Objectivo:
 
Pretende-se avaliar a utilização desta tecnologia para a implementação de sistemas de agregação de transações geradas por sensores IoT em que as transações têm um impacto financeiro. Existem sistemas em que as transações em si não têm uma valorização direta mas podem ter consequências financeiras sendo necessário para isso a recolha dos eventos de forma segura e confiável. 
 
Pretende-se assim avaliar a adequabilidade destas novas alternativas tecnológicas para agregaçãode  eventos para a cobrança de taxas ou serviços variáveis nomeadamente na área da mobilidade. 
 
O objetivo final do trabalho será a exploração dos limites na utilização deste tipo de tecnologias para a finalidade proposta assim como os recursos necessários para a sua implementação prática. Eventualmente deverá ser desenvolvido um piloto demonstrador para a validação prática dos resultados.

title: Dissertação: A Monte Carlo Algorithm for Semantic Steganography
observations: This topic was proposed by João Figueira (85185) and, hence, he has already manifested interest in this thesis.
objectives: Steganography is the practice of concealing a message within some other carrier or cover message. It is used to allow the sending of hidden information through communication channels where third parties would only be aware of the explicit information in the carrier message. This thesis aims to study novel approaches to text in text stenography. The algorithms to be studied and developed  will use the redundancy in language semantics as the space for the hidden message and improve on existing algorithms by not requiring the message receiver to be aware of the specific redundancies of any cover message and by being able to be used on mediums where slight information loss can happen, such as speech.

title: DISSERTAÇÂO: Enrichment of Location Databases
objectives:
Geographic databases, such as those powered by OpenStreeMap (OSM) (https://www.openstreetmap.org/) contain much useful information on many locations and points of interest around the globe. This information, however, is mostly limited to geographic coordinates and, at best, a category describing the type of location.

The goal of this dissertation is to design and implement an automated solution to complement the information present in OSM with other types of data found on the Web. 

For example, take a location such as "Cinema Ideal". You can find its coordinates and a link to the official website, but not, for instance, its opening hours or ticket prices. Your solution should be able to follow the link to the website and extract such information.
requirements: The background required can be found in the "Information Processing and Retrieval" and other related courses. The student should be comfortable with math and statistics.

title: (Dissertação) Autonomous Vehicles Reference Model
location: INOV INESC Inovação - Rua Alves Redol, 9 - 7º andar
observations: Para mais informações sff mande um mail para mms@tecnico.ulisboa.pt
objectives:
The objectives for this master thesis are the following: describe the problem and propose and evaluate a solution. The problem should be defined, and the value of a solution justified. The solution should be a design research artefact (constructs, models, methods, or instantiations) that requires knowledge of theory. The evaluation should be based on a demonstration that solves one or more instances of the problem.

The problem is the lack of a reference model for implementing an autonomous vehicle ecosystem (laws, cars, money, app, charging stations, parking spaces, payment systems, etc, etc, etc.) that stakeholders can take advantage for implementing self-driving cars in new cities. In this thesis the student will start by modelling the Boston pilot in Archimate, then generalize the model into a reference model, and finally evaluate the proposed reference model using another city such as Lisbon. The external adviser is a long-time top manager in the cars industry that is now doing research on autonomous cars.
requirements: The student must dedicate at least three full working days per week to the thesis, and manage the thesis as a project using Scrum.

title: Dissertação: Conscientiousness Vis - Visualização Adaptável Consoante a Personalidade
objectives: A personalidade é um fator que determina a forma como a pessoa lida com uma determinada interface, a forma como memoriza e processa informação. Um dos traços de personalidade é a conscienciosidade, que está relacionada com a organização pessoal e implica um desejo de fazer as tarefas de forma correta e levar a sério as obrigações para com os outros. O objetivo desta tese é estudar se o traço de personalidade conscienciosidade é relevante para técnicas de adaptação em Data Visualization. Podem usar o projeto da cadeira de VI como base para o trabalho, de forma a criar novas técnicas de adaptação e avaliar as soluções resultantes.
requirements: Frequência da disciplina de Visualização de Informação - não obrigatório mas preferencial.

title: Dissertation: SDN Synthesis
observations: This project will be co-advised by Luis Pedrosa (new Professor at DEI, starting September 2019) and Fernando Ramos (Professor at FCUL)
objectives:
Building the networks that power modern distributed systems has lead to new designs and architectures that are often not backward compatible with standard network devices and frameworks. This has lead to a recent push for increased programmability and configurability in the network, with different efforts trading off flexibility and performance.

One such approach that has garnered significant traction is software defined networking (SDN). In this paradigm, a logically centralized controller manages a network of SDN switches. The switches can be “programmed” on the fly using a simple set of rules that define patterns for matching packets and the subsequent actions that should be applied to any matched packets. This offers total flexibility for the network control-plane while somewhat limiting the flexibility of the data-plane, allowing it to be implemented in dedicated highly performant hardware.

More recently, the community has been exploring software network functions (NFs), where even the data-plane is implemented in software and new techniques such as kernel-bypass networking have allowed commodity processors to process packets at significant rate. This offers full programmability in the network, but achieving full line-rate and implementing entire networks can be a challenge.

To program entire networks it would be convenient for developers to design and program the network as if it were one big NF with many logical ports connecting to every single network endpoint. This simplifies development at the expense of deployment. One could simply tunnel traffic across the network to a central node that processes all traffic, but this would pose significant scaling challenges. A hybrid approach, much like what SDN offers, is needed.

In this thesis we will explore synthesizing an SDN controller that is functionally equivalent to a logically centralized NF that is given as input. Our specific goal is to build a static analysis tool that analyzes the NF code and subsequently generates an SDN controller that offloads as much packet processing functionality to SDN switches as possible. The end result will be a controller that is compatible with modern SDN deployments, while offering the same programmability of NFs.

title: [Dissertation] Network support for attack detection: change you can believe in!
observations: Esta dissertação será orientada pelo Prof. Fernando Ramos, que passará a ser docente do DEI a partir do 2 semestre de 19/20.
objectives:
As network attacks grow in sophistication and frequency, so does the challenge of their timely detection. Indeed, the stealthiness of new and increasingly common short-lived attacks, deem a slow response to be ineffective. We thus need new methods to detect ongoing attacks, as they happen.

The emergence of programmable network switches (such as Intel/Barefoot Tofino [1], the world’s fastest) and of a language to program them (such as P4 [2]) enable, for the first time, smart & fast reactions to complex network events. From a security point of view, they give support to the development of new mechanisms to respond quickly to ongoing attacks. As network attacks induce deviations from normal traffic patterns, one can leverage existing theoretical advances on streaming algorithms [3,4] that enable real-time monitoring of the traffic changes induced by an attack. The challenge is to be able to fit these smart algorithms in the constrained computational model of modern programmable switches, that need to process packets fast.

In this project, the student will design and implement new algorithms and data-structures to enable the detection of traffic changes while meeting the constraints of programmable switches, as a support mechanism for fast attack detection. As part of the project the student will have the opportunity to work with cutting edge networking technology, including programming a Barefoot Tofino switch [1] using P4 [2].

The project will be co-advised by Fernando Ramos (who recently joined the IST as Associate Prof.) and will be co-advised by Salvatore Signorello, post-doc researcher at FCUL.

[1] Barefoot Tofino: World's fastest P4-programmable Ethernet switch ASICs, https://www.barefootnetworks.com/products/brief-tofino/
[2] https://p4.org
[3] Z. Liu et al, One Sketch to Rule Them All: Rethinking Network Flow Monitoring with UnivMon, SIGCOMM’16
[4] B. Krishnamurth et al., Sketch-based change detection: methods, evaluation, and applications, IMC'03
requirements: The students must have a good background in distributed systems.

title: Dissertação: STAKE - Secure Tracing of Anomalies using previous Knowledge and Extensions Dissertação
observations: Proposta elaborado com Kevin Batista Corrales (94131)
objectives:
The Smart Home is one of the promises of the Internet of Things. It is a challenging environment because it involves people engaged with devices for different purposes.  The devices can be very diverse, ranging from light bulbs, smart plugs, locks, digital assistants, tablets, just to name a few. Most of these devices connect to the Internet, both for operation and for management. There are many different technology providers involved and the current trust models are unsatisfactory, as they usually allow privileged access.

Machine Learning has been applied with success in Internet of Things security. However, there are many different techniques and the best choice for a specific deployment scenario may not be clear. Therefore, it is expected that while there will be wider adoption of this kind of approach for intrusion detection and other privacy and security solutions for the Smart Home and beyond; at the same time, structured data will be required for training and a flexible execution model will allow the combination and comparison of different techniques.

The goal of this work is two-fold:
Create an infrastructure for capturing smart home operation traffic in different detail levels: network traces, network flows, summary features; and store this data in a persistent repository with adequate indexing for retrieval, for example, selecting by device, and by time range;
Provide an execution environment with plug-ins for anomaly detection using Machine Learning models trained from the capture data archives and applied to the near real-time detection of device operation anomalies.

Example plug-ins, to be created and executed on the proposed platform, are Outlier detection, K-Means and Random Tree Algorithms approach for the intrusion detection problem.
requirements: Full-time (40 hour a week) commitment to academic activities (i.e. no part-time jobs).

title: [Dissertation] Functional and Socio-emotional Test Agents
location: This work will be developed at Grupo Inteligência Artificial para a Sociedade (GAIPS) - INESC-ID, IST-Taguspark and Laboratório de Jogos do IST- Taguspark.
observations: This work will be integrated in the European Research project iv4XR - Intelligent Verification/Validation for Extended Reality Based Systems, starting in October 2019. There is a potential follow-up of the dissertation after completion, into a more deep research work that may lead to a PhD.
objectives:
One challenge in the extended reality (XR) industry, such as games, towards advancing further is the lack of advanced testing tools to address XR systems’ fine grained and high level of interactivity and realism. These kind of tests are very hard to automate and there is very little technology support beyond very rudimentary record and replay tools that only work for simple scenarios. Without automation, the XR industry has to resort to expensive user (manual) testing with limited range and furthermore non-regressive. This work aims to build a novel verification and validation technology for XR systems based on techniques from AI to support automatic functional and user experience assessment.
The overall goal is the development of socio-emotional test agents (SETAs) to do such assessment systematically, while minimizing the manual effort. The main SETAs’ features to be provided are:
1.	Well founded emotion appraisal. A SETA uses a well established emotion appraisal theory to simulate the affective state of the human user that the SETA represents.
2.	Social variability. Many XRs have a broad range of users. The same scenarios may evoke different emotion to users of different social types, e.g. elderly users may respond differently than young users, and likewise female and male users may experience the scenarios differently and, therefore, it is also important to take this variability into account when assessing UX qualities. To be able to do this, we will therefore extend the emotion model with social variability, hence allowing SETAs to simulate users of various social types. 
3.	Progression model. This allows SETA to appraise UX-relevant user states that grow over time, such as, fatigue and user’s skill.
This dissertation will work on the foundations to build socio-emotional test agents and will create a first version of such agents.
requirements: The student needs to have very good programming skills, and preferably knowledge of agent methodologies and machine learning methods.

title: Projeto: Marinporter marine litter reporting, mobile development, ux/ui, citizen science
location: ITI / LARSYS fieldwork to be conducted in Madeira with support form a research project
observations: If you get sea sick this might not be the project for you :-)
objectives: As much as 40 percent of the ocean is heavily affected by pollution, depleted fisheries, loss of coastal habitats and other human activities. Marine litter poses many concerns for the health of both marine species as well as humans. This project will provide the design and the development of mobile application, capable of geotagging and reporting the marine litter, used by citizen scientists, and providing the gamification aspects for performing the classification. Selected candidate will work in close collaboration with other members of the interdisciplinary team including marine biologists from Ocean Observatory in Madeira. Activities will include: (i) Mobile Application Development - allowing the application to collect data in local database and use external API and server to upload the data; and (ii) Mobile Application Design - allowing the successful GUI for mobile applications including the reward system of gamification, facilitating the citizen scientists to report the marine litter.

supervisors: António Paulo Teles de Menezes Correia Leitão (100%)
title: Dissertation: Game Engines for Algorithmic Design
observations: Este tema destina-se ao aluno Ricardo de Lemos Filipe.
objectives:
Algorithmic Design allows the conception of buildings through
algorithms. Currently, programming environments for algorithmic
design tend to rely on full-fledged CAD/BIM systems which were
designed for interactive use and do not employ photo-realism in normal
operation. Moreover, complex 3D buildings tend to cause visualization
and navigation problems on traditional CAD/BIM tools. 

On the other hand, modern game engines were designed to provide
realistic visualization and fluid navigation even for very large building
models. For this reason, they are now being used for visualization and
rendering in architecture.

This thesis will explore game engines, more specifically, Unreal Engine, 
as a dedicated visualizer for 3D models produced through algorithmic design.

title: Dissertation: FastViz - Visualizing Dynamically Evolving Big Data
observations:
As técnicas tradicionais para visualização de informação lidam com conjuntos de dados conhecidos à partida e de pequenas dimensões (mesmo milhares de items é pouco, neste contexto). Se quisermos visualizar Big Data precisamos de algo novo. Temos já uma abordagem que permite ir agregando os dados progressivamente, mas as transições têm que ser melhores, e também as visualizações!

E se a natureza dos dados mudra em tempo real? Será possível a visualização salientar os novos padrões, outliers, etc. que se tornam relevantes? Sem que se perca o contexto da análise que estava a ser feita? Para além disso, será necessário integrar a visualização com um Sistema de big data streaming, como prova de conceito.
objectives: Desenvolver técnicas de visualização capazes de mostrar grandes quantidades de informação, com foco em dados não quantitativos e no estudo da melhor forma de efetuar transições eficientes e fáceis de compreender!
requirements: Frequência da UC de Visualização de Informação

title: Dissertação: GroupSensing - Influência do fator grupo em respostas sensoriais
objectives: A influência do grupo na tomada de decisão, velocidade de resposta, empatia, e até na perceção de dor, já foi descrita. Também a disposição para comprar (willingness to buy) é influenciada pelo mesmo. Mas será que a percepção sensorial da marca e a sua interferência na disposição para comprar sofrem de um bias cognitivo? Ou seja, será que a afiliação a grupos desportivos poderá alterar a percepção do sabor e outras características sensoriais de um produto? O objetivo desta dissertação é investigar o bias cognitivo no processamento da informação tendo em conta as influências do grupo através da utilização de métodos de Brain-Computer Interfaces. O trabalho será desenvolvido em conjunto com o laboratório de desporto e saúde da Universidade Europeia.
requirements: Conceitos de programação em Python: não obrigatórios mas preferenciais.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Project: ELAN++: Improving an Annotation Tool for Sign Language Processing
location: This work is a collaboration between VIMMI (https://vimmi.inesc-id.pt/) and L2F (https://www.l2f.inesc-id.pt/) research groups at INESC-ID. You will conduct your work at Tagus Park (Oeiras).
observations: This work will be conducted in a collaboration with Universidade Católica Portuguesa that will provide access to professional signers and annotators. You will be part of a multidisciplinary team working on a larger research project that aims to create a virtual signing avatar.
objectives:
Sign language recognition, generation, and translation is a research field with potential to break down barriers experienced by Deaf people when using technologies as well as improve communication between Deaf and hearing users. For example, intelligent assistants could respond to people signing to a video camera or automatically translate speech to sign language animations. However, current natural language processing methods, machine learning techniques, and computer-generated avatars expect annotated data as input.

Producing annotated video corpora is a highly expensive, time-intensive, and error-prone process [1]. This originates a lack of annotated datasets that are crucial for training sign language technologies, limiting scientific advancements in the field. It is thus imperative we build better annotation tools. Although previous software has been proposed [2-4], there is a lack of understanding of the needs and the challenges experienced by linguistic experts performing such work.

In this thesis, you will improve an open-source annotation software (i.e. ELAN [5]) to aid the annotation process in terms of both segmenting and annotating the input video, resulting in higher productivity and accuracy. 

Your tasks will include:
1) Analysis of existing annotation tools and processes;
2) Collect requirements to extend ELAN;
3) Develop the tool;
5) Evaluate the solution with linguistic experts (Universidade Católica Portuguesa);
6) Write your master thesis.

References:
[1] Danielle Bragg, Oscar Koller, Mary Bellard, Larwan Berke, Patrick Boudreault, Annelies Braffort, Naomi Caselli, Matt Huenerfauth, Hernisa Kacorri, Tessa Verhoef, Christian Vogler, and Meredith Ringel Morris. 2019. Sign Language Recognition, Generation, and Translation: An Interdisciplinary Perspective. In The 21st International ACM SIGACCESS Conference on Computers and Accessibility (ASSETS ’19), 16–31. https://doi.org/10.1145/3308561.3353774
[2] Émilie Chételat-Pelé, Annelies Braffort, and J Véronis. 2008. Sign Language Corpus Annotation: toward a new Methodology. In LREC.
[3] Onno A. Crasborn. 2015. Transcription and Notation Methods. In Research Methods in Sign Language Studies. John Wiley & Sons, Ltd, 74–88. DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.1002/9781118346013.ch5
[4] Philippe Dreuw and Hermann Ney. 2008. Towards automatic sign language annotation for the elan tool. In Workshop Programme. 50.
[5] The Max Planck Institute for Psycholinguistics The language Archive. 2018. ELAN. (2018). https: //tla.mpi.nl/tools/tla-tools/elan/elan-description/ Accessed 2019-04-29.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação || GP3: Governance blueprints of Programs, Projects and Portfolios
observations: Mais detalhes em  https://sites.google.com/site/vasconcelosandre/teses/mestrado/temas-mestrado
objectives:
Motivação:
 
O tema de Governo (Governance) nas organizações, com uma sólida base de conhecimento nas mais diversas disciplinas de investigação, tais como a área de gestão e de sociologia das organizações, entre outras, tem particular relevância no contexto dos projetos, programas e portfolios das organizações. Projetos, enquanto ‘organizações temporárias’ e únicas visam dar resposta ao cumprimento de um objetivo estratégico da organização, sendo cada vez mais importantes para a sobrevivência da organização.

A definição de blueprints (vistas ou diagramas) que explicitem os atores e roles de governo associados no domínio dos projetos, programas e portfolios da organização é um desafio no contexto da Arquitetura Empresarial da organização.

Descrição:

O desafio que esta tese pretende endereçar é desenvolver a cartografia de um projeto, programa ou portfolio numa organização, com explicitação de elementos (roles) associados aos diferentes governos, das diferentes organizações (projetos, programas e portfolios). Pretende-se assim propor viewpoints da arquitetura empresarial (para desenvolver blueprints organizacionais) que explicitem os atores e roles de governo associados no domínio dos projetos, programas e portfolios da organização.
Assim, o aluno começará por proceder ao Levantamento do estado da arte da Governanção de programas, projetos e portfolio no contexto da arquitetura empresarial. Este levantamento deverá incluir frameworks de modelação de arquitetura empresarial, de estratégia, governação e gestão de projetos, e ferramentas de modelação de arquitetura empresarial (incluindo Archimate e Motivation extension; Framework; TOGAF; UML, BPMN; BMM; UAF). 

Tendo por base uma framework de arquitetura empresarial o aluno deve proceder a proposta de viewpoints para modelação da Governance de Programas, Projetos e Portfolios.

Finalmente os viewpoints propostos deverão ser aplicados na produção de bluepints (vistas) para a explicitação de modelos de governane em projetos, programas, portfolios, no contexto da arquitetura empresarial de uma organização que tem a seu cargo a produção de bens e serviços fundamentais ao funcionamento do Estado Português.
requirements:
Resultados Esperados:
1. Proposta de viewpoints para modelação da Governance de Programas, Projetos e Portfolios no contexto da arquitetura empresarial.
2. Elaboração de blueprints de governane em projetos, programas, portfolios em contexto empresarial
3. Publicação de artigo.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: Análise dinâmica de smart-contracts
objectives:
Smart-contracts são pequenos programas que são executados numa blockchain. Os contratos de Ethereum, são compilados para EVM, Ethereum Virtual Machine, e executados na blockchain Ethereum. A arquitectura da EVM é a de uma stack machine que, apesar de ser fácil de implementar, dificulta a análise dos programas.

O objectivo desta tese é desenvolver técnicas e ferramentas que permitam analisar smart-contracts compilados em EVM, abstraindo-os, e utilizando técnicas comuns de linguagens de programação tais como symbolic execution.
requirements: Fortes conhecimentos de Linguagens de Programação

title: Projecto: Creating Smart Houses with DomoBus
objectives: O sistema DomoBus destina-se à implementação de casas inteligentes e tem vindo a ser desenvolvido no Técnico. Este sistema oferece um conjunto de características inovadoras que se pretendem testar e avaliar. Serão implementados alguns casos de uso que ilustrem as suas capacidades em tornar uma habitação ou pequeno edifício mais "inteligente" e será avaliado o grau de generalidade das soluções e a facilidade de aplicação noutras habitações. Pretende-se ainda comparar o sistema DomoBus com as tecnologias IoT mais recentes como, por exemplo, o sistema Alexa da Amazon ou o Google Home. Face aos resultados dos testes e da avaliação a efectuar poderão ser definidas modificações ou extensões ao sistema DomoBus com vista ao seu melhoramento.

title: Dissertation: Distributed system for cooperative deanonymization of Tor circuits
observations: This work will be performed in collaboration with Diogo Barradas, a PhD student with expertise in traffic analysis, censorship resistance systems, and machine learning.
objectives:
The Tor anonymity network is used by numerous individuals engaged in criminal activities. To help investigate such activities, some governments instruct their homeland network providers to collaborate with police authorities by helping to deanonymize Tor communications. In order to deanonymize a Tor circuit, network providers must intercept the traffic in strategic points of the circuit (e.g., at the entry node and at the exit node) and correlate the timing properties of the respective packets so as to link source and destination of the communication endpoints. However, achieving this at such a large scale poses several challenges. First, to deanonymize a specific Tor circuit, network providers need to share traffic traces of many other circuits, which could reveal the identity of individuals engaged in benign activities, such as whistleblowers, reporters, or undercover agents. Second, this need for sharing traffic information constitutes a big hurdle, since oftentimes the Tor circuit endpoints are located in different countries, where the network providers are highly conditioned by the respective national security policies.

Our goal is to build Torpedo, a distributed system aimed at enabling international cooperation between network providers for the purpose of deanonymizing targeted Tor circuits without disclosing information about out-of-scope circuits. To achieve this, Torpedo will rely on a set of middleboxes deployed within the networks of the participating network providers. These middleboxes are responsible for analyzing the local traffic and whenever instructed by the police authorities to deanonymize a given Tor circuit linked to a suspect IP, a deanonymization query will be disseminated across the Torpedo middleboxes; the system will then identify the matching circuit endpoints with high probability without exposing any locally collected traces. An additional challenge will be in revealing across network providers only minimal amount of information about the investigated Tor circuit itself. To prevent potential abuses, Torpedo must also implement authentication and accountability mechanisms so that the queries operate exclusively under the control of the police authorities. This work will advance the state of the art by devising new protocols that combine ML-based traffic analysis with zero-knowledge algorithms for privacy protection purposes.

The mains tasks of this project will be: 1) review the related work, 2) design the Torpedo system, 3) implement a prototype, 4) evaluate the system through simulations, 5) write a scientific article, and 6) write a dissertation.
requirements: Interest in distributed systems, security, and machine learning. Attendance in the forensics cyber-security course.

title: Dissertation: Automated logic circuit invention
objectives: Logic circuits are currently designed by humans, which does not guarantee optimality and the process is error-prone. The objective of this thesis is to develop a system that would automatically invent new circuits. The techniques that may be considered are evolutionary approaches or embeddings into neural networks.
requirements: Programming skills at the BSc level. Understanding of standard machine learning algorithms.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: AI Social Relationship Engine
location: Este trabalho realiza-se no Grupo de Inteligência Artificial para a Sociedade  (GAIPS) - INESC-ID, IST-Taguspark e no Laboratório de Jogos do IST- Taguspark.
objectives:
A nossa interação com entidades inteligentes (robots, assitentes virtuais e personagens em jogos) é cada vez mais frequente. Um dos fatores para que essa interação tenha sucesso está na capacidade dos agentes (e das pessoas) em estabelecer relações sociais adequadas, que devido à natureza destas entidades (com autonomia e pro-atividade, e muitas vezes apresentadas como atores sociais) requer mecanismos semelhantes às relações entre humanos.
O objectivo do trabalho é o desenvolvimento de uma ferramenta para facilitar a criação de personagens (em jogos ou robots) com capacidade de gerir relações sociais (com humanos e outros agentes). 
O trabalho irá seguir a literatura em ciências humanas (ex: psicologia e sociologia) para formalizar o conceito de relação social inter-pessoal e definir os processos de dinamismo envolvidos (ex: como se estabelecem e evolvem essas relações). Existe trabalho relacionado na área de computação de agentes com capacidade de relacionamento social. Pretende-se um levantamento das abordagems existentes e uma formalização nova de forma a que a relação social seja vista com um conceito de primeira ordem que seja integrado diretamente nos processos de decisão do agente para que este delibere sobre isso. Por exemplo, para poder criar desejos e intenções sobre as suas relações.
A abordagem a desenvolver segue uma teoria cognitiva de relações sociais multi-dimensional e discreta. Que define as relações socias em estágios de progressão com comportamentos adequados e inadequados para cada um deles. Uma versão preliminar deste trabalho pode ser encontada aqui:
https://fenix.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/downloadFile/395142121434/AntonioSoares_RelationshipModelArticle.pdf
Espera-se neste trabalho a criação do mecanismo de comportamento dos agentes, a criação de um cenário simples de demonstração e a realização de alguns estudos para aferir a qualidade do trabalho.
requirements: Conhecimentos e interesse em Inteligência Artificial Interativa. Forte interesse por temas de investigação.

title: Dissertação: Increasing privacy in interactions between robot and humans using Blockchain - testing in an healthcare environment
objectives:
Os sistemas de informação hospitalares apresentam um conjunto significativo de desafios para o Engenheiro Informático. A privacidade localiza-se, hoje, no topo destes desafios afectando uma multiplicidade de pessoas que trabalham, ou usam, cuidados de saúde. Por outro lado, os robots quando inseridos nos ambientes hospitalares introduzem uma capacidade acrescida de benefício social, mas também de recolha de dados em grande quantidade. Estes dados têm que ser tratados atendendo aos requisitos legais, p.e., impostos pelo RGPD. Assim, torna-se clara a necessidade de encontrar novas soluções que suportem esta preocupação. Neste sentido, o Blockchain é uma solução que contem propriedades compatíveis com os requisitos de privacidade impostos pelo RGPD. 
Em específico pretende-se testar uma plataforma já existente, sendo para isso necessário efectuar um levantamento do contexto existente com uma clara definição das variáveis dinâmicas mais relevantes existentes.

Assim, são esperados os principais resultados: 1. levantamento de estado da arte sobre soluções e implementações conhecidas na comunidade científica e empresarial, tendo em vista a identificação exacta do problema a ser resolvido; 2. representação de um modelo conceptual que vise propor uma solução para o problema identificado; 3. definição, de testes de um protótipo que permite integrar dados do ambiente com interacção social entre robot e humanos e a solução Blockchain; 4. avaliação dos resultados obtidos no ponto 3 como justificação para a correcta solução escolhida no ponto 2.; 5. publicação de artigo(s) ao longo da execução da tese.

Androulaki, E., Barger, A., Bortnikov, V., Cachin, C., Christidis, K., De Caro, A., Enyeart, D., Ferris, C., Laventman, G., Manevich, Y., et al.: Hyperledger fabric: a distributed operating system for permissioned blockchains. In: Proceedings of the 13th ACM EuroSys Conference (2018)

title: Dissertação: Mono2Micro - From a Monolith to Microservices: Microservices architecture modeller
objectives:
The microservices architecture allows the existence of several autonomous agile development teams but result in a distributed system where the aspect of consistency becomes critical, the CAP theorem.

As results of previous MSc thesis, a tool was developed for monolith applications, developed using Spring-Boot and Fénix-Framework, that applies static code analysis to collect which domain entities are accessed by each one of the application's controllers, uses similarity measures to define clusters, and provides a user interface to allow the software developer analyse different partitioning hypothesis.

The goal of this thesis is to extend the existing Mono2Micro to develop a microservices architecture modeller for result of the clustering algorithm. The modeller should guide the architecture through the application of microservices patterns and updated information on the impact of the modelling process in the metric provided by Mono2Micro.
requirements: Study the microservices architectural patterns.

title: Dissertação: Sensitive data tracking for emerging web pages featuring WebAssembly code
observations: This work will be performed in collaboration with Tiago Brito, a PhD student with expertise in web security.
objectives:
Web pages manipulate a lot of sensitive information in ways that the end-users have no clue of. For example, data items such as personal identifying records, passwords, user credentials, or cookies that are accessed by web pages can be exfiltrated to untrusted third-parties (e.g., ad-networks) without the user’s awareness. Such fears are even more justifiable today because of the potential vulnerabilities in web page code that can be exploited by attackers in order to collect valuable data and perform data breaches or identity theft. Moreover, the emergence of WebAssembly makes things even more complex. Rather than consisting of traditional HTML DOM and JavaScript code, popular web browsers now allow for web pages to include WebAssembly code, a new low-level code format written in WASM language that can run at near bear-metal performance. For its performance boost, WebAssembly promises to deeply change the web in the near future by fostering the development of sophisticated web client applications that can be downloaded on-the-fly and executed inside the browser. However, this complexity will make it even more difficult to monitor how the web pages handle end-users’ sensitive data. In particular, the wide API exposed to WASM code along with heterogeneous interactions with other web page components (i.e., DOM and JavaScript) open new paths for web pages to collect more sensitive user data and stealthily exfiltrate it from the browser.

The goal of this project is to build EyeBrowser, an extension to the Chrome web browser that will enable end-users to keep track of how WASM-powered web pages handle their sensitive data items. Essentially, EyeBrowser will taint sensitive sources of data (e.g., web page input fields for reading credit card information, or API calls to the web camera) and keep track of how this information flows inside the web page until it reaches sensitive data sinks suchs as outgoing network connections. With this basic functionality, EyeBrowser can be used for a range of usage scenarios: detection of vulnerabilities inside the web pages, blocking unwanted data flows based on user-defined privacy policies, or regulatory compliance validation (e.g., check that specific data is computed by the web page on the browser alone and is not uploaded to the cloud). This project will be developed in several progressive steps. First, it will investigate a small set of critical data types to be tracked, e.g., credit card data. The second stage will be focused on building EyeBrowser’s taint tracking features for these data types. To this end, we will leverage pre-existing tools for information flow control on independent domains, namely DOM, JavaScript code, and C/C++ code. Then, we will adapt and incorporate them inside EyeBrowser so as to implement taint tracking across all components of a web page loaded into Chrome. A third stage will extend EyeBrowser with mechanisms for privacy policy enforcement and compliance validation. We expect this work to make original scientific contributions.
requirements: Interest in web security. Willingness to learn JavaScript and WebAssembly languages.

supervisors: Helena Sofia Andrade Nunes Pereira Pinto (50%)
title: [Dissertação] Da Imagem para a Música
observations: Para mais informação contactar H. Sofia Pinto sofia(at)inesc-id.pt (http://ontol.inesc-id.pt/~sofia/) ou Nuno Correia nmc(at)fct.unl.pt (http://ctp.di.fct.unl.pt/~nmc/)
objectives:
Music Generation is an interesting topic of Computational Creativity and in this Thesis we aim at continuing with the creation of music from images.
Previous work (http://web.tecnico.ulisboa.pt/ist173393) has drawn the attention of musicians and musicologist that interpret the music generated solely from the pixels (colours) as interesting and experimental.
In the previous work several design decisions have been made that have lead to the final result. For instance, the use of MIDI has prevented us from introducing guitars since the timbre is not synthesized with an adequate plausibility. Colors, their histogram and its variations were used, while one could have used the identification of lines, objects and use them to introduce new tracks in the music. The introduction of drums involved a conversion of visual mood into a musical mood while it could have used the changes in colors to abstract an appropriate drum rhythm.The images that were used to generate music came from photographs of famous paintings and did not take into account texture or volumes. Another approach under development tries to find the focus of the image and use whatever is found as the object from which the mapping features are to be extracted.
In the context of this Thesis, we aim at further elaborating on this Music Generation application under development.

The Project will involve meetings with musicians and musicologists (experts on the domain).
requirements: Esta tese requer conhecimentos em Música e Composição Musical.Este Tese envolve programação de algoritmos genéticos e outras abordagens usadas tradicionalmente em Criatividade Computacional.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Dissertação: ITLingo/PSL: Gestão de Projectos mais Eficiente
objectives:
No âmbito da iniciativa de investigação ITLingo/PSL (Project Plan Specification Language) tem sido definida uma linguagem textual para especificação rigorosa de planos de projeto (linguagem PSL, cuja versão preliminar se encontra disponível a partir de  https://github.com/ITLingo/PSL.  

No âmbito deste projeto pretende-se que o aluno investigue e consolide os seus conhecimentos nas áreas da gestão de projetos informáticos, processos/metodologias de desenvolvimento de sistemas (processos ágeis e tradicionais), nas suas múltiplas dimensões, tais como âmbito, recursos e organização, comunicação, tempo, custos, qualidade, risco. Pretende-se em particular que o aluno possa explorar os seguintes aspetos (a definir em maior detalhe no decurso do trabalho): 
(i) Definição de templates de planos de projeto segundo diferentes processos (e.g., Scrum, OpenUP, Kaban, RUP); 
(ii) Definir mecanismos de alinhamento e rastreabilidade entre tarefas e requisitos; 
(iii) Definir mecanismos de controlo e execução do projeto, nomeadamente gráficos e dashboards para visualização do desempenho do projeto; e 
(iv) Definir mecanismos de integração/interoperabilidade com sistemas colaborativos de gestão de projetos (e.g., Microsoft Project, Wrike, Atlassian).

Este projeto deverá desenvolver-se ao longo das seguintes fases:
A primeira fase consiste na análise e definição do problema e na investigação sobre a iniciativa ITLingo/PSL, bem como o aprofundamento do corpo de conhecimento relacionado com a gestão de projetos (e.g., PMBoK, SWBoK), e ainda a análise de templates e ferramentas de gestão de projeto. 
A segunda fase consiste no desenvolvimento de modelos (templates) de planos de projeto de acordo com a linguagem PSL, e segundo diferentes processos/metodologias (ágeis e tradicionais). Estas tarefas deverão permitir explorar os aspetos acima referidos e estender e validar a própria linguagem PSL.
A terceira fase consiste na definição de projetos concretos (a definir), que permitam a consequente avaliação e discussão dos resultados produzidos.

supervisors: Flavia Santoro (Universidade do Estado do Rio de Janeiro) flaviamariasantoro@gmail.com (50%)
specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: (Dissertação) Digital Transformation Reference Model
location: INOV INESC Inovação - Rua Alves Redol, 9 - 7º andar
observations:
Para mais informações sff mande um mail para mms@tecnico.ulisboa.pt

Tese acompanhada pela aluna de doutoramento Silvia Gomes.

Tese atribuída ao aluno David Fernandes
objectives:
The objectives for this master thesis are the following: describe the problem and propose and evaluate a solution. The problem should be defined, and the value of a solution justified. The solution should be a design research artefact (constructs, models, methods, or instantiations) that requires knowledge of theory. The evaluation should be based on a demonstration that solves one or more instances of the problem.

The problem is that companies are struggling to innovate using digital technologies, but most people have no idea where to start. In this thesis the student will continue to develop a digital transformation reference model that was already started by a master student this year, and submitted to an international research conference. In this thesis the student will complement the draft reference model with a (agile based) implementation guide, references to other reference models (such as frameworks and standards) as well as case studies of practical application. The evaluation will be based on a real-world demonstration. The external supervisor is a senior researcher that is an expert on digital innovation.
requirements: The student must dedicate at least three full working days per week to the thesis, and manage the thesis as a project using Scrum.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: DISSERTAÇÃO: Extração e Visualização de Indicadores de Desinformação (Fake News)
observations: Os alunos interessados na realização deste trabalho devem contactar o supervisor no sentido de obterem esclarecimentos adicionais e por forma a agendar uma entrevista inicial.
objectives:
Massive online textual content emerges every day. Although there are some fact-checking initiatives, their reach is still limited and not capable to cover all the news articles and blog posts published on the Internet. Thus, with this master project, we propose to empower news consumers with assisting tools designed to facilitate the evaluation on the credibility of the textual content. The main goals of the project are: i) to study a range of metrics, or indicators, which could offer the readers the means to self-regulate news consumption, ii) to develop an online visualization tool in order to present consumers the information indicators and iii) to evaluate the proposed information indicators under a consumer perspective to identify which indicators have the highest impact in the news consumption process. By designing such a framework to analyze news content collected from multiple sources, both in Portuguese and in English languages, we expect to contribute with the journalistic community to foster the development of awareness on how readers consume information.

The proposed master project covers the following subtasks: i) The identification of news articles metrics and patterns that could potentially be used to combat disinformation from a user perspective. We will investigate indicators empirically associated to the disinformation that are normally employed in automated tasks by the literature and we will propose additional indicators based on quality journalism metrics. ii) The developlement of a framework (resources, components, methodology, annotated corpora models, lexicons and algorithms) required to analyze news content collected from multiple sources both in Portuguese and in English. iii) The creation of an online graphical prototype (a browser plugin) to present the news consumers the indicators extracted from journalistic articles. iv) The validation of the adequacy of the proposed framework in a real-world scenario, by subjecting the prototype to human evaluation. In this validation phase, the objective is to verify the 
usefulness of the indicators for detecting disinformation according to the users.
requirements:
The work should not be selected by students with incomplete credits, or professional commitments during the dissertation development period. 
Previous knowledge in machine learning, information extraction, natural language processing, and information systems (e.g., through relevant credits completed in relevant MEIC courses) is valued. The work will involve software development, therefore it is expected that software packages will be used to perform experiments with machine learning algorithms, such as the PyTorch or keras.io libraries.

For students interested in obtaining more information on the techniques to be studied/developed in the context of this work, in particular with regard to techniques for text classification, it is advisable to read the articles:

Information indicators:
- Fuhr, Norbert, et al. "An Information Nutritional Label for Online Documents." SIGIR Forum. Vol. 51. No. 3. 2017.
- Gollub, Tim, Martin Potthast, and Benno Stein. "Shaping the Information Nutrition Label." NewsIR@ ECIR 2079 (2018): 9-11
- Kevin, Vincentius, et al. "Information Nutrition Labels: A Plugin for Online News Evaluation." Proceedings of the First Workshop on Fact Extraction and VERification (FEVER). 2018.

Quality journalism:
- Lacy, Stephen, and Tom Rosenstiel. "Defining and measuring quality journalism." New Brunswick, Rutgers (2015).

title: Dissertação: Método Monte-Carlo para o Cálculo da Exponencial de uma Matriz
observations: Co-orientação externa: Prof. Juan Acebron, ISCTE (juan.acebron@gmail.com)
objectives:
Os métodos de Monte Carlo podem ser usados como alternativa aos métodos clássicos para resolver problemas intratáveis para estes. Foi proposta recentemente uma abordagem Monte Carlo para o cálculo da função exponencial sobre uma matriz. Este novo método pode realizar o cálculo de posições individuais da matriz resultado, permitindo a resolução de problemas significativamente mais complexos. Embora a matriz original seja esparsa, a matriz resultado não o será em geral, portanto não representável em memória por ser demasiado grande, inviabilizando os métodos clássicos.

O objetivo desta tese é desenvolver um algoritmo Monte Carlo para o cálculo da exponencial da uma matriz aplicado à resolução das equações de estado de circuitos. A matriz resultado permitirá o cálculo direto do valor das variáveis de estado em qualquer instante de tempo para qualquer nó do circuito. Esta abordagem poderá ser significativamente mais eficiente do que as metodologias atuais, que envolvem a simulação numérica de equações complexas em intervalos discretos de tempo até se chegar ao instante pretendido.
requirements: A frequência da unidade curricular de Computação Paralela e Distribuída é desejável embora não obrigatória. Interesse em computação paralela é um requisito.

specializationAreas: Architecture and Management of Information Systems
title: Projecto - SeaView
observations:

Para este trabalho, serão postos à disposição do projecto os dados das previsões horárias produzidos pelo Maretec..

Desenhar e desenvolver um sistema para a visualização em dispositivos móveis de previsões de tempo, mar e qualidade da água em instalações balneares (praias).
Integração dos resultados em Maretec Forecast (forecast.maretec.org)
